SA: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच |धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः |मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय ||
EN: Dhritarashtra said: O Sanjay, after gathering on the holy field of Kurukshetra, and desiring to fight, what did my sons and the sons of Pandu do?

SA: सञ्जय उवाच ।दृष्ट्वा तु पाण्डवानीकं व्यूढं दुर्योधनस्तदा ।आचार्यमुपसङ्गम्य राजा वचनमब्रवीत् ।। ।।
EN: Sanjay said: On observing the Pandava army standing in military formation, King Duryodhan approached his teacher Dronacharya, and said the following words.

SA: पश्यैतां पाण्डुपुत्राणामाचार्य महतीं चमूम् ।व्यूढां द्रुपदपुत्रेण तव शिष्येण धीमता ।। ।।
EN: Duryodhan said: Respected teacher! Behold the mighty army of the sons of Pandu, so expertly arrayed for battle by your own gifted disciple, the son of Drupad.

SA: अत्र शूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि
EN: Behold in their ranks are many powerful warriors, like Yuyudhan, Virat, and Drupad, wielding mighty bows and equal in military prowess to Bheem and Arjun. There are also accomplished heroes like Dhrishtaketu, Chekitan, the gallant King of Kashi, Purujit, Kuntibhoj, and Shaibya—all the best of men. In their ranks, they also have the courageous Yudhamanyu, the gallant Uttamauja, the son of Subhadra, and the sons of Draupadi, who are all great warrior chiefs.

SA: अत्र शूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि
EN: Behold in their ranks are many powerful warriors, like Yuyudhan, Virat, and Drupad, wielding mighty bows and equal in military prowess to Bheem and Arjun. There are also accomplished heroes like Dhrishtaketu, Chekitan, the gallant King of Kashi, Purujit, Kuntibhoj, and Shaibya—all the best of men. In their ranks, they also have the courageous Yudhamanyu, the gallant Uttamauja, the son of Subhadra, and the sons of Draupadi, who are all great warrior chiefs.

SA: अत्र शूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि
EN: Behold in their ranks are many powerful warriors, like Yuyudhan, Virat, and Drupad, wielding mighty bows and equal in military prowess to Bheem and Arjun. There are also accomplished heroes like Dhrishtaketu, Chekitan, the gallant King of Kashi, Purujit, Kuntibhoj, and Shaibya—all the best of men. In their ranks, they also have the courageous Yudhamanyu, the gallant Uttamauja, the son of Subhadra, and the sons of Draupadi, who are all great warrior chiefs.

SA: अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम |नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थं तान्ब्रवीमि ते ||
EN: O best of Brahmins, hear too about the principal generals on our side, who are especially qualified to lead. These I now recount unto you.

SA: भवान्भीष्मश्च कर्णश्च कृपश्च समितिञ्जय: |अश्वत्थामा विकर्णश्च सौमदत्तिस्तथैव च ||
EN: There are personalities like yourself, Bheeshma, Karna, Kripa, Ashwatthama, Vikarn, and Bhurishrava, who are ever victorious in battle.

SA: अन्ये च बहव: शूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविता: |
EN: Also, there are many other heroic warriors, who are prepared to lay down their lives for my sake. They are all skilled in the art of warfare, and equipped with various kinds of weapons.

SA: अपर्याप्तं तदस्माकं बलं भीष्माभिरक्षितम् |
EN: The strength of our army is unlimited and we are safely marshalled by Grandsire Bheeshma, while the strength of the Pandava army, carefully marshalled by Bheem, is limited.

SA: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिता: |भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्त: सर्व एव हि ||
EN: Therefore, I call upon all the generals of the Kaurava army now to give full support to Grandsire Bheeshma, even as you defend your respective strategic points.

SA: तस्य सञ्जनयन्हर्षं कुरुवृद्ध: पितामह: |सिंहनादं विनद्योच्चै: शङ्खं दध्मौ प्रतापवान् ||
EN: Then, the grand old man of the Kuru dynasty, the glorious patriarch Bheeshma, roared like a lion, and blew his conch shell very loudly, giving joy to Duryodhan.

SA: तत: शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च पणवानकगोमुखा: |सहसैवाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत् ||
EN: Thereafter, conches, kettledrums, bugles, trumpets, and horns suddenly blared forth, and their combined sound was overwhelming.

SA: तत: श्वेतैर्हयैर्युक्ते महति स्यन्दने स्थितौ |माधव: पाण्डवश्चैव दिव्यौ शङ्खौ प्रदध्मतु: ||
EN: Then, from amidst the Pandava army, seated in a glorious chariot drawn by white horses, Madhav and Arjun blew their Divine conch shells.

SA: पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनञ्जय: |पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशङ्खं भीमकर्मा वृकोदर: ||
EN: Hrishikesh blew his conch shell, called Panchajanya, and Arjun blew the Devadutta. Bheem, the voracious eater and performer of herculean tasks, blew his mighty conch, called Paundra.

SA: अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिर: |नकुल: सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ || काश्यश्च परमेष्वास: शिखण्डी च महारथ: |धृष्टद्युम्नो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्चापराजित: || द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वश: पृथिवीपते |सौभद्रश्च महाबाहु: शङ्खान्दध्मु: पृथक् पृथक् ||
EN: King Yudhishthir, blew the Anantavijay, while Nakul and Sahadev blew the Sughosh and Manipushpak. The excellent archer and king of Kashi, the great warrior Shikhandi, Dhrishtadyumna, Virat, and the invincible Satyaki, Drupad, the five sons of Draupadi, and the mighty-armed Abhimanyu, son of Subhadra, all blew their respective conch shells, O Ruler of the earth.

SA: अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिर: |नकुल: सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ || काश्यश्च परमेष्वास: शिखण्डी च महारथ: |धृष्टद्युम्नो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्चापराजित: || द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वश: पृथिवीपते |सौभद्रश्च महाबाहु: शङ्खान्दध्मु: पृथक् पृथक् ||
EN: King Yudhishthir, blew the Anantavijay, while Nakul and Sahadev blew the Sughosh and Manipushpak. The excellent archer and king of Kashi, the great warrior Shikhandi, Dhrishtadyumna, Virat, and the invincible Satyaki, Drupad, the five sons of Draupadi, and the mighty-armed Abhimanyu, son of Subhadra, all blew their respective conch shells, O Ruler of the earth.

SA: अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिर: |नकुल: सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ || काश्यश्च परमेष्वास: शिखण्डी च महारथ: |धृष्टद्युम्नो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्चापराजित: || द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वश: पृथिवीपते |सौभद्रश्च महाबाहु: शङ्खान्दध्मु: पृथक् पृथक् ||
EN: King Yudhishthir, blew the Anantavijay, while Nakul and Sahadev blew the Sughosh and Manipushpak. The excellent archer and king of Kashi, the great warrior Shikhandi, Dhrishtadyumna, Virat, and the invincible Satyaki, Drupad, the five sons of Draupadi, and the mighty-armed Abhimanyu, son of Subhadra, all blew their respective conch shells, O Ruler of the earth.

SA: स घोषो धार्तराष्ट्राणां हृदयानि व्यदारयत् |
EN: The terrific sound thundered across the sky and the earth, and shattered the hearts of your sons, O Dhritarasthra.

SA: अथ व्यवस्थितान्दृष्ट्वा धार्तराष्ट्रान् कपिध्वज: |प्रवृत्ते शस्त्रसम्पाते धनुरुद्यम्य पाण्डव: || हृषीकेशं तदा वाक्यमिदमाह महीपते |
EN: At that time, the son of Pandu, Arjun, who had the insignia of Hanuman on the flag of his chariot, took up his bow. Seeing your sons arrayed against him, O King, Arjun then spoke the following words to Shree Krishna.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मेऽच्युत || यावदेतान्निरीक्षेऽहं योद्धुकामानवस्थितान् |कैर्मया सह योद्धव्यमस्मिन् रणसमुद्यमे ||
EN: Arjun said: O Infallible One, please take my chariot to the middle of both armies, so that I may look at the warriors arrayed for battle, whom I must fight in this great combat.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मेऽच्युत || यावदेतान्निरीक्षेऽहं योद्धुकामानवस्थितान् |कैर्मया सह योद्धव्यमस्मिन् रणसमुद्यमे ||
EN: Arjun said: O Infallible One, please take my chariot to the middle of both armies, so that I may look at the warriors arrayed for battle, whom I must fight in this great combat.

SA: योत्स्यमानानवेक्षेऽहं य एतेऽत्र समागता: |धार्तराष्ट्रस्य दुर्बुद्धेर्युद्धे प्रियचिकीर्षव: ||
EN: I desire to see those who have come here to fight on the side of the evil-minded son of Dhritarasthra, wishing to please him.

SA: सञ्जय उवाच |एवमुक्तो हृषीकेशो गुडाकेशेन भारत |सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये स्थापयित्वा रथोत्तमम् ||
EN: Sanjay said: O Dhritarasthra, having thus been addressed by Arjun, the conqueror of sleep, Shree Krishna then drew the magnificent chariot between the two armies.

SA: भीष्मद्रोणप्रमुखत: सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम् |उवाच पार्थ पश्यैतान्समवेतान्कुरूनिति ||
EN: In the presence of Bheeshma, Dronacharya, and all the other kings, Shree Krishna said: O Parth, behold these Kurus gathered here.

SA: तत्रापश्यत्स्थितान् पार्थ: पितृ नथ पितामहान् |आचार्यान्मातुलान्भ्रातृ न्पुत्रान्पौत्रान्सखींस्तथा || श्वशुरान्सुहृदश्चैव सेनयोरुभयोरपि |
EN: There, Arjun could see stationed in both armies, his fathers, grandfathers, teachers, maternal uncles, brothers, cousins, sons, nephews, grand-nephews, friends, fathers-in-law, and well-wishers.

SA: तान्समीक्ष्य स कौन्तेय: सर्वान्बन्धूनवस्थितान् || कृपया परयाविष्टो विषीदन्निदमब्रवीत् |
EN: Seeing all his relatives present there, Arjun, the son of Kunti, was overwhelmed with compassion, and with deep sorrow, spoke the following words.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |दृष्ट्वेमं स्वजनं कृष्ण युयुत्सुं समुपस्थितम् || सीदन्ति मम गात्राणि मुखं च परिशुष्यति |
EN: Arjun said: O Krishna, seeing my own kinsmen arrayed for battle here and intent on killing each other, my limbs are giving way and my mouth is drying up.

SA: वेपथुश्च शरीरे मे रोमहर्षश्च जायते || गाण्डीवं स्रंसते हस्तात्वक्चै व परिदह्यते |न च शक्नोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मन: ||  निमित्तानि च पश्यामि विपरीतानि केशव |न च श्रेयोऽनुपश्यामि हत्वा स्वजनमाहवे ||
EN: My whole body shudders; my hair is standing on end. My bow, the Gāṇḍīv, is slipping from my hand, and my skin is burning all over. My mind is in quandary and whirling in confusion; I am unable to hold myself steady any longer. O Krishna, killer of the Keshi demon, I only see omens of misfortune. I do not foresee how any good can come from killing my own kinsmen in this battle.

SA: वेपथुश्च शरीरे मे रोमहर्षश्च जायते || गाण्डीवं स्रंसते हस्तात्वक्चै व परिदह्यते |न च शक्नोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मन: ||  निमित्तानि च पश्यामि विपरीतानि केशव |न च श्रेयोऽनुपश्यामि हत्वा स्वजनमाहवे ||

SA: न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च |किं नो राज्येन गोविन्द किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा || येषामर्थे काङ्क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगा: सुखानि च |त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च ||
EN: O Krishna, I do not desire the victory, kingdom, or the happiness accruing it. Of what avail will be a kingdom, pleasures, or even life itself, when the very persons for whom we covet them, are standing before us for battle?

SA: न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च |किं नो राज्येन गोविन्द किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा || येषामर्थे काङ्क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगा: सुखानि च |त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च ||
EN: O Krishna, I do not desire the victory, kingdom, or the happiness accruing it. Of what avail will be a kingdom, pleasures, or even life itself, when the very persons for whom we covet them, are standing before us for battle?

SA: आचार्या: पितर: पुत्रास्तथैव च पितामहा: |मातुला: श्वशुरा: पौत्रा: श्याला: सम्बन्धिनस्तथा ||  एतान्न हन्तुमिच्छामि घ्नतोऽपि मधुसूदन |अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतो: किं नु महीकृते ||
EN: Teachers, fathers, sons, grandfathers, maternal uncles, grandsons, fathers-in-law, grand-nephews, brothers-in-law, and other kinsmen are present here, staking their lives and riches. O Madhusudan, I do not wish to slay them, even if they attack me. If we kill the sons of Dhritarashtra, what satisfaction will we derive from the dominion over the three worlds, what to speak of this Earth?

SA: आचार्या: पितर: पुत्रास्तथैव च पितामहा: |मातुला: श्वशुरा: पौत्रा: श्याला: सम्बन्धिनस्तथा ||  एतान्न हन्तुमिच्छामि घ्नतोऽपि मधुसूदन |अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतो: किं नु महीकृते ||

If we kill the sons of Dhritarashtra, what satisfaction will we derive from the dominion over the three worlds, what to speak of this Earth?

SA: निहत्य धार्तराष्ट्रान्न: का प्रीति: स्याज्जनार्दन |पापमेवाश्रयेदस्मान्हत्वैतानाततायिन: ||  || तस्मान्नार्हा वयं हन्तुं धार्तराष्ट्रान्स्वबान्धवान् |स्वजनं हि कथं हत्वा सुखिन: स्याम माधव ||
EN: O Maintainer of all living entities, what pleasure will we derive from killing the sons of Dhritarasthra? Even though they may be aggressors, sin will certainly come upon us if we slay them. Hence, it does not behoove us to kill our own cousins, the sons of Dhritarashtra, and friends. O Madhav (Krishna), how can we hope to be happy by killing our own kinsmen?

SA: निहत्य धार्तराष्ट्रान्न: का प्रीति: स्याज्जनार्दन |पापमेवाश्रयेदस्मान्हत्वैतानाततायिन: ||  || तस्मान्नार्हा वयं हन्तुं धार्तराष्ट्रान्स्वबान्धवान् |स्वजनं हि कथं हत्वा सुखिन: स्याम माधव ||
EN: O Maintainer of all living entities, what pleasure will we derive from killing the sons of Dhritarasthra? Even though they may be aggressors, sin will certainly come upon us if we slay them. Hence, it does not behoove us to kill our own cousins, the sons of Dhritarashtra, and friends. O Madhav (Krishna), how can we hope to be happy by killing our own kinsmen?

SA: यद्यप्येते न पश्यन्ति लोभोपहतचेतस: |कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं मित्रद्रोहे च पातकम् || कथं न ज्ञेयमस्माभि: पापादस्मान्निवर्तितुम् |कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं प्रपश्यद्भिर्जनार्दन ||
EN: Their thoughts are overpowered by greed and they see no wrong in annihilating their relatives or wreaking treachery upon friends. Yet, O Janardan (Krishna), why should we, who can clearly see the crime in killing our kindred, not turn away from this sin?

SA: यद्यप्येते न पश्यन्ति लोभोपहतचेतस: |कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं मित्रद्रोहे च पातकम् || कथं न ज्ञेयमस्माभि: पापादस्मान्निवर्तितुम् |कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं प्रपश्यद्भिर्जनार्दन ||
EN: Their thoughts are overpowered by greed and they see no wrong in annihilating their relatives or wreaking treachery upon friends. Yet, O Janardan (Krishna), why should we, who can clearly see the crime in killing our kindred, not turn away from this sin?

SA: कुलक्षये प्रणश्यन्ति कुलधर्मा: सनातना: |धर्मे नष्टे कुलं कृत्स्नमधर्मोऽभिभवत्युत ||
EN: When a dynasty is destroyed, its traditions get vanquished, and the rest of the family becomes involved in irreligion.

SA: अधर्माभिभवात्कृष्ण प्रदुष्यन्ति कुलस्त्रिय: |स्त्रीषु दुष्टासु वार्ष्णेय जायते वर्णसङ्कर: ||
EN: With the preponderance of vice, O Krishna, the women of the family become immoral; and from the immorality of women, O descendent of Vrishni, unwanted progeny are born.

SA: सङ्करो नरकायैव कुलघ्नानां कुलस्य च |पतन्ति पितरो ह्येषां लुप्तपिण्डोदकक्रिया: ||
EN: An increase in unwanted children results in hellish life both for the family and for those who destroy the family. Deprived of the sacrificial offerings, the ancestors of such corrupt families also fall.

SA: दोषैरेतै: कुलघ्नानां वर्णसङ्करकारकै: |उत्साद्यन्ते जातिधर्मा: कुलधर्माश्च शाश्वता: ||
EN: Through the evil deeds of those who destroy the family tradition and thus give rise to unwanted progeny, a variety of social and family welfare activities are ruined.

SA: उत्सन्नकुलधर्माणां मनुष्याणां जनार्दन |नरकेऽनियतं वासो भवतीत्यनुशुश्रुम ||
EN: O Janardan (Krishna), I have heard from the learned that those who destroy family traditions dwell in hell for an indefinite period of time.

SA: अहो बत महत्पापं कर्तुं व्यवसिता वयम् |यद्राज्यसुखलोभेन हन्तुं स्वजनमुद्यता: || यदि मामप्रतीकारमशस्त्रं शस्त्रपाणय: |धार्तराष्ट्रा रणे हन्युस्तन्मे क्षेमतरं भवेत् ||
EN: Alas! How strange it is that we have set our mind to perform this great sin. Driven by the desire for kingly pleasures, we are intent on killing our own kinsmen. It will be better if, with weapons in hand, the sons of Dhritarashtra kill me unarmed and unresisting on the battlefield.

SA: अहो बत महत्पापं कर्तुं व्यवसिता वयम् |यद्राज्यसुखलोभेन हन्तुं स्वजनमुद्यता: || यदि मामप्रतीकारमशस्त्रं शस्त्रपाणय: |धार्तराष्ट्रा रणे हन्युस्तन्मे क्षेमतरं भवेत् ||
EN: Alas! How strange it is that we have set our mind to perform this great sin. Driven by the desire for kingly pleasures, we are intent on killing our own kinsmen. It will be better if, with weapons in hand, the sons of Dhritarashtra kill me unarmed and unresisting on the battlefield.

SA: सञ्जय उवाच |तं तथा कृपयाविष्टमश्रुपूर्णाकुलेक्षणम् |विषीदन्तमिदं वाक्यमुवाच मधुसूदन: ||
EN: Sanjay said: Seeing Arjun overwhelmed with pity, his mind grief-stricken, and his eyes full of tears, Shree Krishna spoke the following words.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |कुतस्त्वा कश्मलमिदं विषमे समुपस्थितम् |अनार्यजुष्टमस्वर्ग्यमकीर्तिकरमर्जुन ||
EN: The Supreme Lord said: My dear Arjun, how has this delusion overcome you in this hour of peril? It is not befitting an honorable person. It leads not to the higher abodes, but to disgrace.

SA: क्लैब्यं मा स्म गम: पार्थ नैतत्तवय्युपपद्यते |क्षुद्रं हृदयदौर्बल्यं त्यक्त्वोत्तिष्ठ परन्तप ||
EN: O Parth, it does not befit you to yield to this unmanliness. Give up such petty weakness of heart and arise, O vanquisher of enemies.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |कथं भीष्ममहं सङ्ख्ये द्रोणं च मधुसूदन |इषुभि: प्रतियोत्स्यामि पूजार्हावरिसूदन ||
EN: Arjun said: O Madhusudan, how can I shoot arrows in battle on men like Bheeshma and Dronacharya, who are worthy of my worship, O destroyer of enemies?

SA: गुरूनहत्वा हि महानुभावान्श्रेयो भोक्तुं भैक्ष्यमपीह लोके |हत्वार्थकामांस्तु गुरूनिहैवभुञ्जीय भोगान् रुधिरप्रदिग्धान् ||
EN: It would be better to live in this world by begging, than to enjoy life by killing these noble elders, who are my teachers. If we kill them, the wealth and pleasures we enjoy will be tainted with blood.

SA: न चैतद्विद्म: कतरन्नो गरीयोयद्वा जयेम यदि वा नो जयेयु: |यानेव हत्वा न जिजीविषामस्तेऽवस्थिता: प्रमुखे धार्तराष्ट्रा: ||
EN: We do not even know which result of this war is preferable for us—conquering them or being conquered by them. Even after killing them we will not desire to live. Yet they have taken the side of Dhritarasthra, and now stand before us on the battlefield.

SA: कार्पण्यदोषोपहतस्वभाव: पृच्छामि त्वां धर्मसम्मूढचेता: |यच्छ्रेय: स्यान्निश्चितं ब्रूहि तन्मेशिष्यस्तेऽहं शाधि मां त्वां प्रपन्नम् ||
EN: I am confused about my duty, and am besieged with anxiety and faintheartedness. I am your disciple, and am surrendered to you. Please instruct me for certain what is best for me.

SA: न हि प्रपश्यामि ममापनुद्याद्यच्छोकमुच्छोषणमिन्द्रियाणाम् |अवाप्य भूमावसपत्नमृद्धंराज्यं सुराणामपि चाधिपत्यम् ||
EN: I can find no means of driving away this anguish that is drying up my senses. Even if I win a prosperous and unrivalled kingdom on the earth, or gain sovereignty like the celestial gods, I will be unable to dispel this grief.

SA: सञ्जय उवाच |एवमुक्त्वा हृषीकेशं गुडाकेश: परन्तप |न योत्स्य इति गोविन्दमुक्त्वा तूष्णीं बभूव ह ||
EN: Sanjay said: Having thus spoken, Gudakesh, that chastiser of enemies, addressed Hrishikesh: “Govind, I shall not fight,” and became silent.

SA: तमुवाच हृषीकेश: प्रहसन्निव भारत |सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये विषीदन्तमिदं वच: ||
EN: O Dhritarashtra, thereafter, in the midst of both the armies, Shree Krishna smilingly spoke the following words to the grief-stricken Arjun.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |अशोच्यानन्वशोचस्त्वं प्रज्ञावादांश्च भाषसे |गतासूनगतासूंश्च नानुशोचन्ति पण्डिता: ||
EN: The Supreme Lord said: While you speak words of wisdom, you are mourning for that which is not worthy of grief. The wise lament neither for the living nor for the dead.

SA: न त्वेवाहं जातु नासं न त्वं नेमे जनाधिपा |न चैव न भविष्याम: सर्वे वयमत: परम् ||
EN: Never was there a time when I did not exist, nor you, nor all these kings; nor in the future shall any of us cease to be.

SA: देहिनोऽस्मिन्यथा देहे कौमारं यौवनं जरा |तथा देहान्तरप्राप्तिर्धीरस्तत्र न मुह्यति ||
EN: Just as the embodied soul continuously passes from childhood to youth to old age, similarly, at the time of death, the soul passes into another body. The wise are not deluded by this.

SA: मात्रास्पर्शास्तु कौन्तेय शीतोष्णसुखदु: खदा: |आगमापायिनोऽनित्यास्तांस्तितिक्षस्व भारत ||
EN: O son of Kunti, the contact between the senses and the sense objects gives rise to fleeting perceptions of happiness and distress. These are non-permanent, and come and go like the winter and summer seasons. O descendent of Bharat, one must learn to tolerate them without being disturbed.

SA: यं हि न व्यथयन्त्येते पुरुषं पुरुषर्षभ |समदु:खसुखं धीरं सोऽमृतत्वाय कल्पते ||
EN: O Arjun, noblest amongst men, that person who is not affected by happiness and distress, and remains steady in both, becomes eligible for liberation.

SA: नासतो विद्यते भावो नाभावो विद्यते सत: |उभयोरपि दृष्टोऽन्तस्त्वनयोस्तत्वदर्शिभि: ||
EN: Of the transient there is no endurance, and of the eternal there is no cessation. This has verily been observed by the seers of the truth, after studying the nature of both.

SA: अविनाशि तु तद्विद्धि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् |विनाशमव्ययस्यास्य न कश्चित्कर्तुमर्हति ||
EN: That which pervades the entire body, know it to be indestructible. No one can cause the destruction of the imperishable soul.

SA: अन्तवन्त इमे देहा नित्यस्योक्ता: शरीरिण: |अनाशिनोऽप्रमेयस्य तस्माद्युध्यस्व भारत ||
EN: Only the material body is perishable; the embodied soul within is indestructible, immeasurable, and eternal. Therefore, fight, O descendent of Bharat.

SA: य एनं वेत्ति हन्तारं यश्चैनं मन्यते हतम् |उभौ तौ न विजानीतो नायं हन्ति न हन्यते ||
EN: Neither of them is in knowledge—the one who thinks the soul can slay and the one who thinks the soul can be slain. For truly, the soul neither kills nor can it be killed.

SA: न जायते म्रियते वा कदाचिनायं भूत्वा भविता वा न भूय: |अजो नित्य: शाश्वतोऽयं पुराणोन हन्यते हन्यमाने शरीरे ||
EN: The soul is neither born, nor does it ever die; nor having once existed, does it ever cease to be. The soul is without birth, eternal, immortal, and ageless. It is not destroyed when the body is destroyed.

SA: वेदाविनाशिनं नित्यं य एनमजमव्ययम् |कथं स पुरुष: पार्थ कं घातयति हन्ति कम् ||
EN: O Parth, how can one who knows the soul to be imperishable, eternal, unborn, and immutable kill anyone or cause anyone to kill?

SA: वासांसि जीर्णानि यथा विहायनवानि गृह्णाति नरोऽपराणि |तथा शरीराणि विहाय जीर्णान्यन्यानि संयाति नवानि देही ||
EN: As a person sheds worn-out garments and wears new ones, likewise, at the time of death, the soul casts off its worn-out body and enters a new one.

SA: नैनं छिन्दन्ति शस्त्राणि नैनं दहति पावक: |न चैनं क्लेदयन्त्यापो न शोषयति मारुत: ||
EN: Weapons cannot shred the soul, nor can fire burn it. Water cannot wet it, nor can the wind dry it.

SA: अच्छेद्योऽयमदाह्योऽयमक्लेद्योऽशोष्य एव च |नित्य: सर्वगत: स्थाणुरचलोऽयं सनातन: ||
EN: The soul is unbreakable and incombustible; it can neither be dampened nor dried. It is everlasting, in all places, unalterable, immutable, and primordial.

SA: अव्यक्तोऽयमचिन्त्योऽयमविकार्योऽयमुच्यते |तस्मादेवं विदित्वैनं नानुशोचितुमर्हसि ||
EN: The soul is spoken of as invisible, inconceivable, and unchangeable. Knowing this, you should not grieve for the body.

SA: अथ चैनं नित्यजातं नित्यं वा मन्यसे मृतम् |तथापि त्वं महाबाहो नैवं शोचितुमर्हसि ||
EN: If, however, you think that the self is subject to constant birth and death, O mighty-armed Arjun, even then you should not grieve like this.

SA: जातस्य हि ध्रुवो मृत्युर्ध्रुवं जन्म मृतस्य च |तस्मादपरिहार्येऽर्थे न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि ||
EN: Death is certain for one who has been born, and rebirth is inevitable for one who has died. Therefore, you should not lament over the inevitable.

SA: अव्यक्तादीनि भूतानि व्यक्तमध्यानि भारत |अव्यक्तनिधनान्येव तत्र का परिदेवना ||
EN: O scion of Bharat, all created beings are unmanifest before birth, manifest in life, and again unmanifest on death. So why grieve?

SA: आश्चर्यवत्पश्यति कश्चिदेनमाश्चर्यवद्वदति तथैव चान्य: |आश्चर्यवच्चैनमन्य: शृ्णोतिश्रुत्वाप्येनं वेद न चैव कश्चित् ||
EN: Some see the soul as amazing, some describe it as amazing, and some hear of the soul as amazing, while others, even on hearing, cannot understand it at all.

SA: देही नित्यमवध्योऽयं देहे सर्वस्य भारत |तस्मात्सर्वाणि भूतानि न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि ||
EN: O Arjun, the soul that dwells within the body is immortal; therefore, you should not mourn for anyone.

SA: स्वधर्ममपि चावेक्ष्य न विकम्पितुमर्हसि |धर्म्याद्धि युद्धाच्छ्रेयोऽन्यत्क्षत्रियस्य न विद्यते ||
EN: Besides, considering your duty as a warrior, you should not waver. Indeed, for a warrior, there is no better engagement than fighting for upholding of righteousness.

SA: यदृच्छया चोपपन्नं स्वर्गद्वारमपावृतम् |सुखिन: क्षत्रिया: पार्थ लभन्ते युद्धमीदृशम् ||
EN: O Parth, happy are the warriors to whom such opportunities to defend righteousness come unsought, opening for them the stairway to the celestial abodes.

SA: अथ चेतत्वमिमं धर्म्यं संग्रामं न करिष्यसि |तत: स्वधर्मं कीर्तिं च हित्वा पापमवाप्स्यसि ||
EN: If, however, you refuse to fight this righteous war, abandoning your social duty and reputation, you will certainly incur sin.

SA: अकीर्तिं चापि भूतानिकथयिष्यन्ति तेऽव्ययाम् |सम्भावितस्य चाकीर्तिर्मरणादतिरिच्यते ||
EN: People will speak of you as a coward and a deserter. For a respectable person, infamy is worse than death.

SA: भयाद्रणादुपरतं मंस्यन्ते त्वां महारथा: |येषां च त्वं बहुमतो भूत्वा यास्यसि लाघवम् ||
EN: The great generals who hold you in high esteem will think that you fled from the battlefield out of fear, and thus will lose their respect for you.

SA: अवाच्यवादांश्च बहून्वदिष्यन्ति तवाहिता: |निन्दन्तस्तव सामर्थ्यं ततो दु:खतरं नु किम् ||
EN: Your enemies will defame and humiliate you with unkind words, disparaging your might. Alas, what could be more painful than that?

SA: हतो वा प्राप्स्यसि स्वर्गं जित्वा वा भोक्ष्यसे महीम् |तस्मादुत्तिष्ठ कौन्तेय युद्धाय कृतनिश्चय: ||
EN: If you fight, you will either be slain on the battlefield and go to the celestial abodes, or you will gain victory and enjoy the kingdom on earth. Therefore arise with determination, O son of Kunti, and be prepared to fight.

SA: सुखदु:खे समे कृत्वा लाभालाभौ जयाजयौ |ततो युद्धाय युज्यस्व नैवं पापमवाप्स्यसि ||
EN: Fight for the sake of duty, treating alike happiness and distress, loss and gain, victory and defeat. Fulfilling your responsibility in this way, you will never incur sin.

SA: एषा तेऽभिहिता साङ्ख्येबुद्धिर्योगे त्विमां शृणु |बुद्ध्या युक्तो यया पार्थकर्मबन्धं प्रहास्यसि ||
EN: Hitherto, I have explained to you Sānkhya Yog, or analytic knowledge regarding the nature of the soul. Now listen, O Parth, as I reveal Buddhi Yog, or the Yog of Intellect. When you work with such understanding, you will be freed from the bondage of karma.

SA: नेहाभिक्रमनाशोऽस्ति प्रत्यवायो न विद्यते |स्वल्पमप्यस्य धर्मस्य त्रायते महतो भयात् ||
EN: Working in this state of consciousness, there is no loss or adverse result, and even a little effort saves one from great danger.

SA: व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिरेकेह कुरुनन्दन |बहुशाखा ह्यनन्ताश्च बुद्धयोऽव्यवसायिनाम् ||
EN: O descendent of the Kurus, the intellect of those who are on this path is resolute, and their aim is one-pointed. But the intellect of those who are irresolute is many-branched.

SA: यामिमां पुष्पितां वाचं प्रवदन्त्यविपश्चित: |वेदवादरता: पार्थ नान्यदस्तीति वादिन: || कामात्मान: स्वर्गपरा जन्मकर्मफलप्रदाम् |क्रियाविशेषबहुलां भोगैश्वर्यगतिं प्रति ||
EN: Those with limited understanding, get attracted to the flowery words of the Vedas, which advocate ostentatious rituals for elevation to the celestial abodes, and presume no higher principle is described in them. They glorify only those portions of the Vedas that please their senses, and perform pompous ritualistic ceremonies for attaining high birth, opulence, sensual enjoyment, and elevation to the heavenly planets.

SA: यामिमां पुष्पितां वाचं प्रवदन्त्यविपश्चित: |वेदवादरता: पार्थ नान्यदस्तीति वादिन: || कामात्मान: स्वर्गपरा जन्मकर्मफलप्रदाम् |क्रियाविशेषबहुलां भोगैश्वर्यगतिं प्रति ||
EN: Those with limited understanding, get attracted to the flowery words of the Vedas, which advocate ostentatious rituals for elevation to the celestial abodes, and presume no higher principle is described in them. They glorify only those portions of the Vedas that please their senses, and perform pompous ritualistic ceremonies for attaining high birth, opulence, sensual enjoyment, and elevation to the heavenly planets.

SA: भोगैश्वर्यप्रसक्तानां तयापहृतचेतसाम् |व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धि: समाधौ न विधीयते ||
EN: With their minds deeply attached to worldly pleasures and their intellects bewildered by such things, they are unable to possess the resolute determination for success on the path to God.

SA: त्रैगुण्यविषया वेदा निस्त्रैगुण्यो भवार्जुन |निर्द्वन्द्वो नित्यसत्वस्थो निर्योगक्षेम आत्मवान् ||
EN: The Vedas deal with the three modes of material nature, O Arjun. Rise above the three modes to a state of pure spiritual consciousness. Freeing yourself from dualities, eternally fixed in truth, and without concern for material gain and safety, be situated in the self.

SA: यावानर्थ उदपाने सर्वत: सम्प्लुतोदके |तावान्सर्वेषु वेदेषु ब्राह्मणस्य विजानत: ||
EN: Whatever purpose is served by a small well of water is naturally served in all respects by a large lake. Similarly, one who realizes the Absolute Truth also fulfills the purpose of all the Vedas.

SA: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन |मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि ||  ||
EN: You have a right to perform your prescribed duties, but you are not entitled to the fruits of your actions. Never consider yourself to be the cause of the results of your activities, nor be attached to inaction.

SA: योगस्थ: कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय |सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्यो: समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते ||
EN: Be steadfast in the performance of your duty, O Arjun, abandoning attachment to success and failure. Such equanimity is called Yog.

SA: दूरेण ह्यवरं कर्म बुद्धियोगाद्धनञ्जय |बुद्धौ शरणमन्विच्छ कृपणा: फलहेतव: ||
EN: Seek refuge in divine knowledge and insight, O Arjun, and discard reward-seeking actions that are certainly inferior to works performed with the intellect established in Divine knowledge. Miserly are those who seek to enjoy the fruits of their works.

SA: बुद्धियुक्तो जहातीह उभे सुकृतदुष्कृते |तस्माद्योगाय युज्यस्व योग: कर्मसु कौशलम् ||
EN: One who prudently practices the science of work without attachment can get rid of both good and bad reactions in this life itself. Therefore, strive for Yog, which is the art of working skillfully (in proper consciousness).

SA: कर्मजं बुद्धियुक्ता हि फलं त्यक्त्वा मनीषिण: |जन्मबन्धविनिर्मुक्ता: पदं गच्छन्त्यनामयम् ||
EN: The wise endowed with equanimity of intellect, abandon attachment to the fruits of actions, which bind one to the cycle of life and death. By working in such consciousness, they attain the state beyond all suffering.

SA: यदा ते मोहकलिलं बुद्धिर्व्यतितरिष्यति |तदा गन्तासि निर्वेदं श्रोतव्यस्य श्रुतस्य च ||
EN: When your intellect crosses the quagmire of delusion, you will then acquire indifference to what has been heard and what is yet to be heard (about enjoyments in this world and the next).

SA: श्रुतिविप्रतिपन्ना ते यदा स्थास्यति निश्चला |समाधावचला बुद्धिस्तदा योगमवाप्स्यसि ||
EN: When your intellect ceases to be allured by the fruitive sections of the Vedas and remains steadfast in divine consciousness, you will then attain the state of perfect Yog.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |स्थितप्रज्ञस्य का भाषा समाधिस्थस्य केशव |स्थितधी: किं प्रभाषेत किमासीत व्रजेत किम् ||
EN: Arjun said : O Keshav, what is the disposition of one who is situated in divine consciousness? How does an enlightened person talk? How does he sit? How does he walk?

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |प्रजहाति यदा कामान्सर्वान्पार्थ मनोगतान् |आत्मन्येवात्मना तुष्ट: स्थितप्रज्ञस्तदोच्यते ||
EN: The Supreme Lord said: O Parth, when one discards all selfish desires and cravings of the senses that torment the mind, and becomes satisfied in the realization of the self, such a person is said to be transcendentally situated.

SA: दु:खेष्वनुद्विग्नमना: सुखेषु विगतस्पृह: |वीतरागभयक्रोध: स्थितधीर्मुनिरुच्यते ||
EN: One whose mind remains undisturbed amidst misery, who does not crave for pleasure, and who is free from attachment, fear, and anger, is called a sage of steady wisdom.

SA: य: सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्तत्प्राप्य शुभाशुभम् |नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ||
EN: One who remains unattached under all conditions, and is neither delighted by good fortune nor dejected by tribulation, he is a sage with perfect knowledge.

SA: यदा संहरते चायं कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वश: |इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ||
EN: One who is able to withdraw the senses from their objects, just as a tortoise withdraws its limbs into its shell, is established in divine wisdom.

SA: विषया विनिवर्तन्ते निराहारस्य देहिन: |रसवर्जं रसोऽप्यस्य परं दृष्ट्वा निवर्तते ||
EN: Aspirants may restrain the senses from their objects of enjoyment, but the taste for the sense objects remains. However, even this taste ceases for those who realizes the Supreme.

SA: यततो ह्यपि कौन्तेय पुरुषस्य विपश्चित: |इन्द्रियाणि प्रमाथीनि हरन्ति प्रसभं मन: ||
EN: The senses are so strong and turbulent, O son of Kunti, that they can forcibly carry away the mind even of a person endowed with discrimination and practicing self-control.

SA: तानि सर्वाणि संयम्य युक्त आसीत मत्पर: |वशे हि यस्येन्द्रियाणि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ||
EN: They are established in perfect knowledge, who subdue their senses and keep their minds ever absorbed in me.

SA: ध्यायतो विषयान्पुंस: सङ्गस्तेषूपजायते |सङ्गात्सञ्जायते काम: कामात्क्रोधोऽभिजायते ||
EN: While contemplating on the objects of the senses, one develops attachment to them. Attachment leads to desire, and from desire arises anger.

SA: क्रोधाद्भवति सम्मोह: सम्मोहात्स्मृतिविभ्रम: |स्मृतिभ्रंशाद् बुद्धिनाशो बुद्धिनाशात्प्रणश्यति ||
EN: Anger leads to clouding of judgment, which results in bewilderment of the memory. When the memory is bewildered, the intellect gets destroyed; and when the intellect is destroyed, one is ruined.

SA: रागद्वेषवियुक्तैस्तु विषयानिन्द्रियैश्चरन् |आत्मवश्यैर्विधेयात्मा प्रसादमधिगच्छति ||
EN: But one who controls the mind, and is free from attachment and aversion, even while using the objects of the senses, attains the Grace of God.

SA: प्रसादे सर्वदु:खानां हानिरस्योपजायते |प्रसन्नचेतसो ह्याशु बुद्धि: पर्यवतिष्ठते ||
EN: By divine grace comes the peace in which all sorrows end, and the intellect of such a person of tranquil mind soon becomes firmly established in God.

SA: नास्ति बुद्धिरयुक्तस्य न चायुक्तस्य भावना |न चाभावयत: शान्तिरशान्तस्य कुत: सुखम् ||
EN: But an undisciplined person, who has not controlled the mind and senses, can neither have a resolute intellect nor steady contemplation on God. For one who never unites the mind with God there is no peace; and how can one who lacks peace be happy?

SA: इन्द्रियाणां हि चरतां यन्मनोऽनुविधीयते |तदस्य हरति प्रज्ञां वायुर्नावमिवाम्भसि ||
EN: Just as a strong wind sweeps a boat off its chartered course on the water, even one of the senses on which the mind focuses can lead the intellect astray.

SA: तस्माद्यस्य महाबाहो निगृहीतानि सर्वश: |इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ||
EN: Therefore, one who has restrained the senses from their objects, O mighty armed Arjun, is firmly established in transcendental knowledge.

SA: या निशा सर्वभूतानां तस्यां जागर्ति संयमी |यस्यां जाग्रति भूतानि सा निशा पश्यतो मुने: ||
EN: What all beings consider as day is the night of ignorance for the wise, and what all creatures see as night is the day for the introspective sage.

SA: आपूर्यमाणमचलप्रतिष्ठंसमुद्रमाप: प्रविशन्ति यद्वत् |तद्वत्कामा यं प्रविशन्ति सर्वेस शान्तिमाप्नोति न कामकामी ||
EN: Just as the ocean remains undisturbed by the incessant flow of waters from rivers merging into it, likewise the sage who is unmoved despite the flow of desirable objects all around him attains peace, and not the person who strives to satisfy desires.

SA: विहाय कामान्य: सर्वान्पुमांश्चरति नि:स्पृह: |निर्ममो निरहङ्कार: स शान्तिमधिगच्छति ||
EN: That person, who gives up all material desires and lives free from a sense of greed, proprietorship, and egoism, attains perfect peace.

SA: एषा ब्राह्मी स्थिति: पार्थ नैनां प्राप्य विमुह्यति |स्थित्वास्यामन्तकालेऽपि ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृच्छति ||
EN: O Parth, such is the state of an enlightened soul that having attained it, one is never again deluded. Being established in this consciousness even at the hour of death, one is liberated from the cycle of life and death and reaches the Supreme Abode of God.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |ज्यायसी चेत्कर्मणस्ते मता बुद्धिर्जनार्दन |तत्किं कर्मणि घोरे मां नियोजयसि केशव || व्यामिश्रेणेव वाक्येन बुद्धिं मोहयसीव मे |तदेकं वद निश्चित्य येन श्रेयोऽहमाप्नुयाम् ||
EN: Arjun said: O Janardan, if you consider knowledge superior to action, then why do you ask me to wage this terrible war? My intellect is bewildered by your ambiguous advice. Please tell me decisively the one path by which I may attain the highest good.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |ज्यायसी चेत्कर्मणस्ते मता बुद्धिर्जनार्दन |तत्किं कर्मणि घोरे मां नियोजयसि केशव || व्यामिश्रेणेव वाक्येन बुद्धिं मोहयसीव मे |तदेकं वद निश्चित्य येन श्रेयोऽहमाप्नुयाम् ||
EN: Arjun said: O Janardan, if you consider knowledge superior to action, then why do you ask me to wage this terrible war? My intellect is bewildered by your ambiguous advice. Please tell me decisively the one path by which I may attain the highest good.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |लोकेऽस्मिन्द्विविधा निष्ठा पुरा प्रोक्ता मयानघ |ज्ञानयोगेन साङ्ख्यानां कर्मयोगेन योगिनाम् ||
EN: The Blessed Lord said: O sinless one, the two paths leading to enlightenment were previously explained by me: the path of knowledge, for those inclined toward contemplation, and the path of work for those inclined toward action.

SA: न कर्मणामनारम्भान्नैष्कर्म्यं पुरुषोऽश्नुते |न च संन्यसनादेव सिद्धिं समधिगच्छति ||
EN: One cannot achieve freedom from karmic reactions by merely abstaining from work, nor can one attain perfection of knowledge by mere physical renunciation.

SA: न हि कश्चित्क्षणमपि जातु तिष्ठत्यकर्मकृत् |कार्यते ह्यवश: कर्म सर्व: प्रकृतिजैर्गुणै: ||
EN: There is no one who can remain without action even for a moment. Indeed, all beings are compelled to act by their qualities born of material nature (the three guṇas).

SA: कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मरन् |इन्द्रियार्थान्विमूढात्मा मिथ्याचार: स उच्यते ||
EN: Those who restrain the external organs of action, while continuing to dwell on sense objects in the mind, certainly delude themselves and are to be called hypocrites.

SA: यस्त्विन्द्रियाणि मनसा नियम्यारभतेऽर्जुन |कर्मेन्द्रियै: कर्मयोगमसक्त: स विशिष्यते ||
EN: But those karm yogis who control their knowledge senses with the mind, O Arjun, and engage the working senses in working without attachment, are certainly superior.

SA: नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मण: |शरीरयात्रापि च ते न प्रसिद्ध्येदकर्मण: ||
EN: You should thus perform your prescribed Vedic duties, since action is superior to inaction. By ceasing activity, even your bodily maintenance will not be possible.

SA: यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धन: |तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसङ्ग: समाचर ||
EN: Work must be done as a yajña (sacrifice) to the Supreme Lord; otherwise, work causes bondage in this material world. Therefore, O son of Kunti, perform your prescribed duties, without being attached to the results, for the satisfaction of God.

SA: सहयज्ञा: प्रजा: सृष्ट्वा पुरोवाच प्रजापति: |अनेन प्रसविष्यध्वमेष वोऽस्त्विष्टकामधुक् ||
EN: In the beginning of creation, Brahma created humankind along with duties, and said, “Prosper in the performance of these yajñas (sacrifices), for they shall bestow upon you all you wish to achieve.”

SA: देवान्भावयतानेन ते देवा भावयन्तु व: |परस्परं भावयन्त: श्रेय: परमवाप्स्यथ ||
EN: By your sacrifices the celestial gods will be pleased, and by cooperation between humans and the celestial gods, prosperity will reign for all.

SA: इष्टान्भोगान्हि वो देवा दास्यन्ते यज्ञभाविता: |तैर्दत्तानप्रदायैभ्यो यो भुङ्क्ते स्तेन एव स: ||
EN: The celestial gods, being satisfied by the performance of sacrifice, will grant you all the desired necessities of life. But those who enjoy what is given to them, without making offerings in return, are verily thieves.

SA: यज्ञशिष्टाशिन: सन्तो मुच्यन्ते सर्वकिल्बिषै: |भुञ्जते ते त्वघं पापा ये पचन्त्यात्मकारणात् ||
EN: The spiritually-minded, who eat food that is first offered in sacrifice, are released from all kinds of sin. Others, who cook food for their own enjoyment, verily eat only sin.

SA: अन्नाद्भवन्ति भूतानि पर्जन्यादन्नसम्भव: |यज्ञाद्भवति पर्जन्यो यज्ञ: कर्मसमुद्भव: ||
EN: All living beings subsist on food, and food is produced by rains. Rains come from the performance of sacrifice, and sacrifice is produced by the performance of prescribed duties.

SA: कर्म ब्रह्मोद्भवं विद्धि ब्रह्माक्षरसमुद्भवम् |तस्मात्सर्वगतं ब्रह्म नित्यं यज्ञे प्रतिष्ठितम् ||
EN: The duties for human beings are described in the Vedas, and the Vedas are manifested by God himself. Therefore, the all-pervading Lord is eternally present in acts of sacrifice.

SA: एवं प्रवर्तितं चक्रं नानुवर्तयतीह य: |अघायुरिन्द्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति ||
EN: O Parth, those who do not accept their responsibility in the cycle of sacrifice established by the Vedas are sinful. They live only for the delight of their senses; indeed their lives are in vain.

SA: यस्त्वात्मरतिरेव स्यादात्मतृप्तश्च मानव: |आत्मन्येव च सन्तुष्टस्तस्य कार्यं न विद्यते ||
EN: But those who rejoice in the self, who are illumined and fully satisfied in the self, for them, there is no duty.

SA: नैव तस्य कृतेनार्थो नाकृतेनेह कश्चन |न चास्य सर्वभूतेषु कश्चिदर्थव्यपाश्रय: ||
EN: Such self-realized souls have nothing to gain or lose either in discharging or renouncing their duties. Nor do they need to depend on other living beings to fulfill their self-interest.

SA: तस्मादसक्त: सततं कार्यं कर्म समाचर |असक्तो ह्याचरन्कर्म परमाप्नोति पूरुष: ||
EN: Therefore, giving up attachment, perform actions as a matter of duty, for by working without being attached to the fruits, one attains the Supreme.

SA: कर्मणैव हि संसिद्धिमास्थिता जनकादय: |लोकसंग्रहमेवापि सम्पश्यन्कर्तुमर्हसि || यद्यदाचरति श्रेष्ठस्तत्तदेवेतरो जन: |स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदनुवर्तते ||
EN: By performing their prescribed duties, King Janak and others attained perfection. You should also perform your work to set an example for the good of the world. Whatever actions great persons perform, common people follow. Whatever standards they set, all the world pursues.

SA: कर्मणैव हि संसिद्धिमास्थिता जनकादय: |लोकसंग्रहमेवापि सम्पश्यन्कर्तुमर्हसि || यद्यदाचरति श्रेष्ठस्तत्तदेवेतरो जन: |स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदनुवर्तते ||
EN: By performing their prescribed duties, King Janak and others attained perfection. You should also perform your work to set an example for the good of the world. Whatever actions great persons perform, common people follow. Whatever standards they set, all the world pursues.

SA: न मे पार्थास्ति कर्तव्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु किञ्चन |नानवाप्तमवाप्तव्यं वर्त एव च कर्मणि ||
EN: There is no duty for me to do in all the three worlds, O Parth, nor do I have anything to gain or attain. Yet, I am engaged in prescribed duties.

SA: यदि ह्यहं न वर्तेयं जातु कर्मण्यतन्द्रित: |मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्या: पार्थ सर्वश: ||
EN: For if I did not carefully perform the prescribed duties, O Parth, all men would follow my path in all respects.

SA: उत्सीदेयुरिमे लोका न कुर्यां कर्म चेदहम् |सङ्करस्य च कर्ता स्यामुपहन्यामिमा: प्रजा: ||
EN: If I ceased to perform prescribed actions, all these worlds would perish. I would be responsible for the pandemonium that would prevail, and would thereby destroy the peace of the human race.

SA: सक्ता: कर्मण्यविद्वांसो यथा कुर्वन्ति भारत |कुर्याद्विद्वांस्तथासक्तश्चिकीर्षुर्लोकसंग्रहम् ||
EN: As ignorant people perform their duties with attachment to the results, O scion of Bharat, so should the wise act without attachment, for the sake of leading people on the right path.

SA: न बुद्धिभेदं जनयेदज्ञानां कर्मसङ्गिनाम् |जोषयेत्सर्वकर्माणि विद्वान्युक्त: समाचरन् ||
EN: The wise should not create discord in the intellects of ignorant people, who are attached to fruitive actions, by inducing them to stop work. Rather, by performing their duties in an enlightened manner, they should inspire the ignorant also to do their prescribed duties.

SA: प्रकृते: क्रियमाणानि गुणै: कर्माणि सर्वश: |अहङ्कारविमूढात्मा कर्ताहमिति मन्यते ||
EN: All activities are carried out by the three modes of material nature. But in ignorance, the soul, deluded by false identification with the body, thinks itself to be the doer.

SA: तत्ववित्तु महाबाहो गुणकर्मविभागयो: |गुणा गुणेषु वर्तन्त इति मत्वा न सज्जते ||
EN: O mighty-armed Arjun, illumined persons distinguish the soul as distinct from guṇas and karmas. They perceive that it is only the guṇas (in the shape of the senses, mind, etc.) that move amongst the guṇas (in the shape of the objects of perception), and thus they do not get entangled in them.

SA: प्रकृतेर्गुणसम्मूढा: सज्जन्ते गुणकर्मसु |तानकृत्स्नविदो मन्दान्कृत्स्नविन्न विचालयेत् ||
EN: Those who are deluded by the operation of the guṇas become attached to the results of their actions. But the wise who understand these truths should not unsettle such ignorant people who know very little.

SA: मयि सर्वाणि कर्माणि संन्यस्याध्यात्मचेतसा |निराशीर्निनर्ममो भूत्वा युध्यस्व विगतज्वर: ||
EN: Performing all works as an offering unto me, constantly meditate on me as the Supreme. Become free from desire and selfishness, and with your mental grief departed, fight!

SA: ये मे मतमिदं नित्यमनुतिष्ठन्ति मानवा: |श्रद्धावन्तोऽनसूयन्तो मुच्यन्ते तेऽपि कर्मभि: ||
EN: Those who abide by these teachings of mine, with profound faith and free from cavil, are released from the bondage of karma.

SA: ये त्वेतदभ्यसूयन्तो नानुतिष्ठन्ति मे मतम् |सर्वज्ञानविमूढांस्तान्विद्धि नष्टानचेतस: ||
EN: But those who find faults with my teachings, being bereft of knowledge and devoid of discrimination, they disregard these principles and bring about their own ruin.

SA: सदृशं चेष्टते स्वस्या: प्रकृतेर्ज्ञानवानपि |प्रकृतिं यान्ति भूतानि निग्रह: किं करिष्यति ||
EN: Even wise people act according to their natures, for all living beings are propelled by their natural tendencies. What will one gain by repression?

SA: इन्द्रियस्येन्द्रियस्यार्थे रागद्वेषौ व्यवस्थितौ |तयोर्न वशमागच्छेत्तौ ह्यस्य परिपन्थिनौ ||
EN: The senses naturally experience attachment and aversion to the sense objects, but do not be controlled by them, for they are way-layers and foes.

SA: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुण: परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् |स्वधर्मे निधनं श्रेय: परधर्मो भयावह: ||
EN: It is far better to perform one’s natural prescribed duty, though tinged with faults, than to perform another’s prescribed duty, though perfectly. In fact, it is preferable to die in the discharge of one’s duty, than to follow the path of another, which is fraught with danger.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |अथ केन प्रयुक्तोऽयं पापं चरति पूरुष: |अनिच्छन्नपि वार्ष्णेय बलादिव नियोजित: ||
EN: Arjun asked: Why is a person impelled to commit sinful acts, even unwillingly, as if by force, O descendent of Vrishni (Krishna)?

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |काम एष क्रोध एष रजोगुणसमुद्भव: ||महाशनो महापाप्मा विद्ध्येनमिह वैरिणम् ||
EN: The Supreme Lord said: It is lust alone, which is born of contact with the mode of passion, and later transformed into anger. Know this as the sinful, all-devouring enemy in the world.

SA: धूमेनाव्रियते वह्निर्यथादर्शो मलेन च |यथोल्बेनावृतो गर्भस्तथा तेनेदमावृतम् ||
EN: Just as a fire is covered by smoke, a mirror is masked by dust, and an embryo is concealed by the womb, similarly one’s knowledge gets shrouded by desire.

SA: आवृतं ज्ञानमेतेन ज्ञानिनो नित्यवैरिणा |कामरूपेण कौन्तेय दुष्पूरेणानलेन च ||
EN: The knowledge of even the most discerning gets covered by this perpetual enemy in the form of insatiable desire, which is never satisfied and burns like fire, O son of Kunti.

SA: इन्द्रियाणि मनो बुद्धिरस्याधिष्ठानमुच्यते |एतैर्विमोहयत्येष ज्ञानमावृत्य देहिनम् ||
EN: The senses, mind, and intellect are said to be breeding grounds of desire. Through them, it clouds one’s knowledge and deludes the embodied soul.

SA: तस्मात्त्वमिन्द्रियाण्यादौ नियम्य भरतर्षभ |पाप्मानं प्रजहि ह्येनं ज्ञानविज्ञाननाशनम् ||
EN: Therefore, O best of the Bharatas, in the very beginning bring the senses under control and slay this enemy called desire, which is the embodiment of sin and destroys knowledge and realization.

SA: इन्द्रियाणि पराण्याहुरिन्द्रियेभ्य: परं मन: |मनसस्तु परा बुद्धिर्यो बुद्धे: परतस्तु स: ||
EN: The senses are superior to the gross body, and superior to the senses is the mind. Beyond the mind is the intellect, and even beyond the intellect is the soul.

SA: एवं बुद्धे: परं बुद्ध्वा संस्तभ्यात्मानमात्मना |जहि शत्रुं महाबाहो कामरूपं दुरासदम् ||
EN: Thus knowing the soul to be superior to the material intellect, O mighty armed Arjun, subdue the self (senses, mind, and intellect) by the self (strength of the soul), and kill this formidable enemy called lust.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |इमं विवस्वते योगं प्रोक्तवानहमव्ययम् |विवस्वान्मनवे प्राह मनुरिक्ष्वाकवेऽब्रवीत् ||
EN: The Supreme Lord Shree Krishna said: I taught this eternal science of Yog to the Sun-god, Vivasvan, who passed it on to Manu; and Manu in turn instructed it to Ikshvaku.

SA: एवं परम्पराप्राप्तमिमं राजर्षयो विदु: |स कालेनेह महता योगो नष्ट: परन्तप ||
EN: O subduer of enemies, the saintly kings thus received this science of Yog in a continuous tradition. But with the long passage of time, it was lost to the world.

SA: स एवायं मया तेऽद्य योग: प्रोक्त: पुरातन: |भक्तोऽसि मे सखा चेति रहस्यं ह्येतदुत्तमम् ||
EN: The same ancient knowledge of Yog, which is the supreme secret, I am today revealing unto you, because you are my friend as well as my devotee, who can understand this transcendental wisdom.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |अपरं भवतो जन्म परं जन्म विवस्वत: |कथमेतद्विजानीयां त्वमादौ प्रोक्तवानिति ||
EN: Arjun said: You were born much after Vivasvan. How am I to understand that in the beginning you instructed this science to him?

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |बहूनि मे व्यतीतानि जन्मानि तव चार्जुन |तान्यहं वेद सर्वाणि न त्वं वेत्थ परन्तप ||
EN: The Supreme Lord said: Both you and I have had many births, O Arjun. You have forgotten them, while I remember them all, O Parantapa.

SA: अजोऽपि सन्नव्ययात्मा भूतानामीश्वरोऽपि सन् |प्रकृतिं स्वामधिष्ठाय सम्भवाम्यात्ममायया ||
EN: Although I am unborn, the Lord of all living entities, and have an imperishable nature, yet I appear in this world by virtue of Yogmaya, my divine power.

SA: यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत |अभ्युत्थानमधर्मस्य तदात्मानं सृजाम्यहम् ||
EN: Whenever there is a decline in righteousness and an increase in unrighteousness, O Arjun, at that time I manifest myself on earth.

SA: परित्राणाय साधूनां विनाशाय च दुष्कृताम् |धर्मसंस्थापनार्थाय सम्भवामि युगे युगे ||
EN: To protect the righteous, to annihilate the wicked, and to reestablish the principles of dharma I appear on this earth, age after age.

SA: जन्म कर्म च मे दिव्यमेवं यो वेत्ति तत्त्वत: |त्यक्त्वा देहं पुनर्जन्म नैति मामेति सोऽर्जुन ||
EN: Those who understand the divine nature of my birth and activities, O Arjun, upon leaving the body, do not have to take birth again, but come to my eternal abode.

SA: वीतरागभयक्रोधा मन्मया मामुपाश्रिता: |बहवो ज्ञानतपसा पूता मद्भावमागता: ||
EN: Being freed from attachment, fear, and anger, becoming fully absorbed in me, and taking refuge in me, many persons in the past became purified by knowledge of me, and thus they attained my divine love.

SA: ये यथा मां प्रपद्यन्ते तांस्तथैव भजाम्यहम् |मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्या: पार्थ सर्वश: ||
EN: In whatever way people surrender unto me, I reciprocate with them accordingly. Everyone follows my path, knowingly or unknowingly, O son of Pritha.

SA: काङ् क्षन्त: कर्मणां सिद्धिं यजन्त इह देवता: |क्षिप्रं हि मानुषे लोके सिद्धिर्भवति कर्मजा ||
EN: In this world, those desiring success in material activities worship the celestial gods, since material rewards manifest quickly.

SA: चातुर्वर्ण्यं मया सृष्टं गुणकर्मविभागश: |तस्य कर्तारमपि मां विद्ध्यकर्तारमव्ययम् ||
EN: The four categories of occupations were created by me according to people’s qualities and activities. Although I am the creator of this system, know me to be the non-doer and eternal.

SA: न मां कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति न मे कर्मफले स्पृहा |इति मां योऽभिजानाति कर्मभिर्न स बध्यते ||
EN: Activities do not taint me, nor do I desire the fruits of action. One who knows me in this way is never bound by the karmic reactions of work.

SA: एवं ज्ञात्वा कृतं कर्म पूर्वैरपि मुमुक्षुभि: |कुरु कर्मैव तस्मात्त्वं पूर्वै: पूर्वतरं कृतम् ||
EN: Knowing this truth, even seekers of liberation in ancient times performed actions. Therefore, following the footsteps of those ancient sages, you too should perform your duty.

SA: किं कर्म किमकर्मेति कवयोऽप्यत्र मोहिता: |तत्ते कर्म प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् ||
EN: What is action and what is inaction? Even the wise are confused in determining this. Now I shall explain to you the secret of action, by knowing which, you may free yourself from material bondage.

SA: कर्मणो ह्यपि बोद्धव्यं बोद्धव्यं च विकर्मण: |अकर्मणश्च बोद्धव्यं गहना कर्मणो गति: ||
EN: You must understand the nature of all three—recommended action, wrong action, and inaction. The truth about these is profound and difficult to understand.

SA: कर्मण्यकर्म य: पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म य: |स बुद्धिमान्मनुष्येषु स युक्त: कृत्स्नकर्मकृत् ||
EN: Those who see action in inaction and inaction in action are truly wise amongst humans. Although performing all kinds of actions, they are yogis and masters of all their actions.

SA: यस्य सर्वे समारम्भा: कामसङ्कल्पवर्जिता: |ज्ञानाग्निदग्धकर्माणं तमाहु: पण्डितं बुधा: ||
EN: The enlightened sages call those persons wise, whose every action is free from the desire for material pleasures and who have burnt the reactions of work in the fire of divine knowledge.

SA: त्यक्त्वा कर्मफलासङ्गं नित्यतृप्तो निराश्रय: |कर्मण्यभिप्रवृत्तोऽपि नैव किञ्चित्करोति स: ||
EN: Such people, having given up attachment to the fruits of their actions, are always satisfied and not dependent on external things. Despite engaging in activities, they do not do anything at all.

SA: निराशीर्यतचित्तात्मा त्यक्तसर्वपरिग्रह: |शारीरं केवलं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम् ||
EN: Free from expectations and the sense of ownership, with mind and intellect fully controlled, they incur no sin, even though performing actions by one’s body.

SA: यदृच्छालाभसन्तुष्टो द्वन्द्वातीतो विमत्सर: |सम: सिद्धावसिद्धौ च कृत्वापि न निबध्यते ||
EN: Content with whatever gain comes of its own accord, and free from envy, they are beyond the dualities of life. Being equipoised in success and failure, they are not bound by their actions, even while performing all kinds of activities.

SA: गतसङ्गस्य मुक्तस्य ज्ञानावस्थितचेतस: |यज्ञायाचरत: कर्म समग्रं प्रविलीयते ||
EN: They are released from the bondage of material attachments and their intellect is established in divine knowledge. Since they perform all actions as a sacrifice (to God), they are freed from all karmic reactions.

SA: ब्रह्मार्पणं ब्रह्म हविर्ब्रह्माग्नौ ब्रह्मणा हुतम् |ब्रह्मैव तेन गन्तव्यं ब्रह्मकर्मसमाधिना ||
EN: For those who are completely absorbed in God-consciousness, the oblation is Brahman, the ladle with which it is offered is Brahman, the act of offering is Brahman, and the sacrificial fire is also Brahman. Such persons, who view everything as God, easily attain him.

SA: दैवमेवापरे यज्ञं योगिन: पर्युपासते |ब्रह्माग्नावपरे यज्ञं यज्ञेनैवोपजुह्वति ||
EN: Some yogis worship the celestial gods with material offerings unto them. Others worship perfectly who offer the self as sacrifice in the fire of the Supreme Truth.

SA: श्रोत्रादीनीन्द्रियाण्यन्ये संयमाग्निषु जुह्वति |शब्दादीन्विषयानन्य इन्द्रियाग्निषु जुह्वति ||
EN: Others offer hearing and other senses in the sacrificial fire of restraint. Still others offer sound and other objects of the senses as sacrifice in the fire of the senses.

SA: सर्वाणीन्द्रियकर्माणि प्राणकर्माणि चापरे |आत्मसंयमयोगाग्नौ जुह्वति ज्ञानदीपिते ||
EN: Some, inspired by knowledge, offer the functions of all their senses and their life energy in the fire of the controlled mind.

SA: द्रव्ययज्ञास्तपोयज्ञा योगयज्ञास्तथापरे |स्वाध्यायज्ञानयज्ञाश्च यतय: संशितव्रता: ||
EN: Some offer their wealth as sacrifice, while others offer severe austerities as sacrifice. Some practice the eight-fold path of yogic practices, and yet others study the scriptures and cultivate knowledge as sacrifice, while observing strict vows.

SA: अपाने जुह्वति प्राणं प्राणेऽपानं तथापरे |प्राणापानगती रुद्ध्वा प्राणायामपरायणा: || अपरे नियताहारा: प्राणान्प्राणेषु जुह्वति |सर्वेऽप्येते यज्ञविदो यज्ञक्षपितकल्मषा: ||
EN: Still others offer as sacrifice the outgoing breath in the incoming breath, while some offer the incoming breath into the outgoing breath. Some arduously practice prāṇāyām and restrain the incoming and outgoing breaths, purely absorbed in the regulation of the life-energy. Yet others curtail their food intake and offer the breath into the life-energy as sacrifice. All these knowers of sacrifice are cleansed of their impurities as a result of such performances.

SA: अपाने जुह्वति प्राणं प्राणेऽपानं तथापरे |प्राणापानगती रुद्ध्वा प्राणायामपरायणा: || अपरे नियताहारा: प्राणान्प्राणेषु जुह्वति |सर्वेऽप्येते यज्ञविदो यज्ञक्षपितकल्मषा: ||
EN: Still others offer as sacrifice the outgoing breath in the incoming breath, while some offer the incoming breath into the outgoing breath. Some arduously practice prāṇāyām and restrain the incoming and outgoing breaths, purely absorbed in the regulation of the life-energy. Yet others curtail their food intake and offer the breath into the life-energy as sacrifice. All these knowers of sacrifice are cleansed of their impurities as a result of such performances.

SA: यज्ञशिष्टामृतभुजो यान्ति ब्रह्म सनातनम् |नायं लोकोऽस्त्ययज्ञस्य कुतोऽन्य: कुरुसत्तम ||
EN: Those who know the secret of sacrifice, and engaging in it, partake of its remnants that are like nectar, advance toward the Absolute Truth. O best of the Kurus, those who perform no sacrifice find no happiness either in this world or the next.

SA: एवं बहुविधा यज्ञा वितता ब्रह्मणो मुखे |कर्मजान्विद्धि तान्सर्वानेवं ज्ञात्वा विमोक्ष्यसे ||
EN: All these different kinds of sacrifice have been described in the Vedas. Know them as originating from different types of work; this understanding cuts the knots of material bondage.

SA: श्रेयान्द्रव्यमयाद्यज्ञाज्ज्ञानयज्ञ: परन्तप |सर्वं कर्माखिलं पार्थ ज्ञाने परिसमाप्यते ||
EN: O subduer of enemies, sacrifice performed in knowledge is superior to any mechanical material sacrifice. After all, O Parth, all sacrifices of work culminate in knowledge.

SA: तद्विद्धि प्रणिपातेन परिप्रश्नेन सेवया |उपदेक्ष्यन्ति ते ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनस्तत्त्वदर्शिन: ||
EN: Learn the Truth by approaching a spiritual master. Inquire from him with reverence and render service unto him. Such an enlightened Saint can impart knowledge unto you because he has seen the Truth.

SA: यज्ज्ञात्वा न पुनर्मोहमेवं यास्यसि पाण्डव |येन भूतान्यशेषेण द्रक्ष्यस्यात्मन्यथो मयि ||
EN: Following this path and having achieved enlightenment from a Guru, O Arjun, you will no longer fall into delusion. In the light of that knowledge, you will see that all living beings are but parts of the Supreme, and are within me.

SA: अपि चेदसि पापेभ्य: सर्वेभ्य: पापकृत्तम: |सर्वं ज्ञानप्लवेनैव वृजिनं सन्तरिष्यसि ||
EN: Even those who are considered the most immoral of all sinners can cross over this ocean of material existence by seating themselves in the boat of divine knowledge.

SA: यथैधांसि समिद्धोऽग्निर्भस्मसात्कुरुतेऽर्जुन |ज्ञानाग्नि: सर्वकर्माणि भस्मसात्कुरुते तथा ||
EN: As a kindled fire reduces wood to ashes, O Arjun, so does the fire of knowledge burn to ashes all reactions from material activities.

SA: न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते |तत्स्वयं योगसंसिद्ध: कालेनात्मनि विन्दति ||
EN: In this world, there is nothing as purifying as divine knowledge. One who has attained purity of mind through prolonged practice of Yog, receives such knowledge within the heart, in due course of time.

SA: श्रद्धावान् लभते ज्ञानं तत्पर: संयतेन्द्रिय: |ज्ञानं लब्ध्वा परां शान्तिमचिरेणाधिगच्छति ||
EN: Those whose faith is deep and who have practiced controlling their mind and senses attain divine knowledge. Through such transcendental knowledge, they quickly attain everlasting supreme peace.

SA: अज्ञश्चाश्रद्दधानश्च संशयात्मा विनश्यति |नायं लोकोऽस्ति न परो न सुखं संशयात्मन: ||
EN: But persons who possess neither faith nor knowledge, and who are of a doubting nature, suffer a downfall. For the skeptical souls, there is no happiness either in this world or the next.

SA: योगसंन्यस्तकर्माणं ज्ञानसञ्छिन्नसंशयम् |आत्मवन्तं न कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय ||
EN: O Arjun, actions do not bind those who have renounced karm in the fire of Yog, whose doubts have been dispelled by knowledge, and who are situated in knowledge of the self.

SA: तस्मादज्ञानसम्भूतं हृत्स्थं ज्ञानासिनात्मन: |छित्त्वैनं संशयं योगमातिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भारत ||
EN: Therefore, with the sword of knowledge, cut asunder the doubts that have arisen in your heart. O scion of Bharat, establish yourself in karm yog. Arise, stand up, and take action!

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |संन्यासं कर्मणां कृष्ण पुनर्योगं च शंससि |यच्छ्रेय एतयोरेकं तन्मे ब्रूहि सुनिश्चितम् ||
EN: Arjun said: O Shree Krishna, you praised karm sanyās (the path of renunciation of actions), and you also advised to do karm yog (work with devotion). Please tell me decisively which of the two is more beneficial?

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |संन्यास: कर्मयोगश्च नि:श्रेयसकरावुभौ |तयोस्तु कर्मसंन्यासात्कर्मयोगो विशिष्यते ||
EN: The Supreme Lord said: Both the path of karm sanyās (renunciation of actions) and karm yog (working in devotion) lead to the supreme goal. But karm yog is superior to karm sanyās.

SA: ज्ञेय: स नित्यसंन्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न काङ् क्षति |निर्द्वन्द्वो हि महाबाहो सुखं बन्धात्प्रमुच्यते ||
EN: The karm yogis, who neither desire nor hate anything, should be considered always renounced. Free from all dualities, they are easily liberated from the bonds of material energy.

SA: साङ्ख्ययोगौ पृथग्बाला: प्रवदन्ति न पण्डिता: |एकमप्यास्थित: सम्यगुभयोर्विन्दते फलम् ||
EN: Only the ignorant speak of sānkhya (renunciation of actions, or karm sanyās) and karm yog (work in devotion) as different. Those who are truly learned say that by applying ourselves to any one of these paths, we can achieve the results of both.

SA: यत्साङ्ख्यै: प्राप्यते स्थानं तद्योगैरपि गम्यते |एकं साङ्ख्यं च योगं च य: पश्यति स पश्यति ||
EN: The supreme state that is attained by means of karm sanyās is also attained by working in devotion. Hence, those who see karm sanyās and karm yog to be identical, truly see things as they are.

SA: संन्यासस्तु महाबाहो दु:खमाप्तुमयोगत: |योगयुक्तो मुनिर्ब्रह्म नचिरेणाधिगच्छति ||
EN: Perfect renunciation (karm sanyās) is difficult to attain without performing work in devotion (karm yog), O mighty-armed Arjun, but the sage who is adept in karm yog quickly attains the Supreme.

SA: योगयुक्तो विशुद्धात्मा विजितात्मा जितेन्द्रिय: |सर्वभूतात्मभूतात्मा कुर्वन्नपि न लिप्यते ||
EN: The karm yogis, who are of purified intellect, and who control the mind and senses, see the Soul of all souls in every living being. Though performing all kinds of actions, they are never entangled.

SA: नैव किञ्चित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्ववित् |पश्यञ्शृण्वन्स्पृशञ्जिघ्रन्नश्नन्गच्छन्स्वपञ्श्वसन् || प्रलपन्विसृजन्गृह्ण्न्नुन्मिषन्निमिषन्नपि |इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेषु वर्तन्त इति धारयन् ||
EN: Those steadfast in this karm yog, always think, “I am not the doer,” even while engaged in seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, moving, sleeping, breathing, speaking, excreting, and grasping, and opening or closing the eyes. With the light of divine knowledge, they see that it is only the material senses that are moving amongst their objects.

SA: नैव किञ्चित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्ववित् |पश्यञ्शृण्वन्स्पृशञ्जिघ्रन्नश्नन्गच्छन्स्वपञ्श्वसन् || प्रलपन्विसृजन्गृह्ण्न्नुन्मिषन्निमिषन्नपि |इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेषु वर्तन्त इति धारयन् ||
EN: Those steadfast in this karm yog, always think, “I am not the doer,” even while engaged in seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, moving, sleeping, breathing, speaking, excreting, and grasping, and opening or closing the eyes. With the light of divine knowledge, they see that it is only the material senses that are moving amongst their objects.

SA: ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा करोति य: |लिप्यते न स पापेन पद्मपत्रमिवाम्भसा ||
EN: Those who dedicate their actions to God, abandoning all attachment, remain untouched by sin, just as a lotus leaf is untouched by water.

SA: कायेन मनसा बुद्ध्या केवलैरिन्द्रियैरपि |योगिन: कर्म कुर्वन्ति सङ्गं त्यक्त्वात्मशुद्धये ||
EN: The yogis, while giving up attachment, perform actions with their body, senses, mind, and intellect, only for the purpose of self-purification.

SA: युक्त: कर्मफलं त्यक्त्वा शान्तिमाप्नोति नैष्ठिकीम् |अयुक्त: कामकारेण फले सक्तो निबध्यते ||
EN: Offering the results of all activities to God, the karm yogis attain everlasting peace. Whereas those who, being impelled by their desires, work with a selfish motive become entangled because they are attached to the fruits of their actions.

SA: सर्वकर्माणि मनसा संन्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी |नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन् ||
EN: The embodied beings who are self-controlled and detached reside happily in the city of nine gates, free from thinking they are the doers or the cause of anything.

SA: न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभु: |न कर्मफलसंयोगं स्वभावस्तु प्रवर्तते ||
EN: Neither the sense of doership nor the nature of actions comes from God; nor does he create the fruits of actions. All this is enacted by the modes of material nature (guṇas).

SA: नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभु: |अज्ञानेनावृतं ज्ञानं तेन मुह्यन्ति जन्तव: ||
EN: The omnipresent God does not involve himself in the sinful or virtuous deeds of anyone. The living entities are deluded because their inner knowledge is covered by ignorance.

SA: ज्ञानेन तु तदज्ञानं येषां नाशितमात्मन: |तेषामादित्यवज्ज्ञानं प्रकाशयति तत्परम् ||
EN: But for those, in whom this ignorance of the self is destroyed by divine knowledge, that knowledge reveals the Supreme Entity, just as the sun illumines everything in daytime.

SA: तद्बुद्धयस्तदात्मानस्तन्निष्ठास्तत्परायणा: |गच्छन्त्यपुनरावृत्तिं ज्ञाननिर्धूतकल्मषा: ||
EN: Those whose intellect is fixed in God, who are wholly absorbed in God, with firm faith in him as the supreme goal, such persons quickly reach the state from which there is no return, their sins having been dispelled by the light of knowledge.

SA: विद्याविनयसम्पन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि |शुनि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिता: समदर्शिन: ||
EN: The truly learned, with the eyes of divine knowledge, see with equal vision a Brahmin, a cow, an elephant, a dog, and a dog-eater.

SA: इहैव तैर्जित: सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं मन: |निर्दोषं हि समं ब्रह्म तस्माद् ब्रह्मणि ते स्थिता: ||
EN: Those whose minds are established in equality of vision conquer the cycle of birth and death in this very life. They possess the flawless qualities of God, and are therefore seated in the Absolute Truth.

SA: न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्राप्य चाप्रियम् |स्थिरबुद्धिरसम्मूढो ब्रह्मविद् ब्रह्मणि स्थित: ||
EN: Established in God, having a firm understanding of divine knowledge and not hampered by delusion, they neither rejoice in getting something pleasant nor grieve on experiencing the unpleasant.

SA: बाह्यस्पर्शेष्वसक्तात्मा विन्दत्यात्मनि यत्सुखम् |स ब्रह्मयोगयुक्तात्मा सुखमक्षयमश्नुते ||
EN: Those who are not attached to external sense pleasures realize divine bliss in the self. Being united with God through Yog, they experience unending happiness.

SA: ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दु:खयोनय एव ते |आद्यन्तवन्त: कौन्तेय न तेषु रमते बुध: ||
EN: The pleasures that arise from contact with the sense objects, though appearing as enjoyable to worldly-minded people, are verily a source of misery. O son of Kunti, such pleasures have a beginning and an end, and so the wise do not delight in them.

SA: शक्नोतीहैव य: सोढुं प्राक्शरीरविमोक्षणात् |कामक्रोधोद्भवं वेगं स युक्त: स सुखी नर: ||
EN: Those persons are yogis, who before giving up the body are able to check the forces of desire and anger; and they alone are happy.

SA: योऽन्त:सुखोऽन्तरारामस्तथान्तज्र्योतिरेव य: ।स योगी ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं ब्रह्मभूतोऽधिगच्छति ।। ।।
EN: Those who are happy within themselves, enjoying the delight of God within, and are illumined by the inner light, such yogis are united with the Lord and are liberated from material existence.

SA: लभन्ते ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृषय: क्षीणकल्मषा: |छिन्नद्वैधा यतात्मान: सर्वभूतहिते रता: ||
EN: Those holy persons, whose sins have been purged, whose doubts are annihilated, whose minds are disciplined, and who are devoted to the welfare of all beings, attain God and are liberated from material existence.

SA: कामक्रोधवियुक्तानां यतीनां यतचेतसाम् |अभितो ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं वर्तते विदितात्मनाम् ||
EN: For those sanyāsīs, who have broken out of anger and lust through constant effort, who have subdued their mind, and are self-realized, liberation from material existence is both here and hereafter.

SA: स्पर्शान्कृत्वा बहिर्बाह्यांश्चक्षुश्चैवान्तरे भ्रुवो: |प्राणापानौ समौ कृत्वा नासाभ्यन्तरचारिणौ || यतेन्द्रियमनोबुद्धिर्मुनिर्मोक्षपरायण: |विगतेच्छाभयक्रोधो य: सदा मुक्त एव स: ||
EN: Shutting out all thoughts of external enjoyment, with the gaze fixed on the space between the eye-brows, equalizing the flow of the incoming and outgoing breath in the nostrils, and thus controlling the senses, mind, and intellect, the sage who becomes free from desire and fear, always lives in freedom.

SA: स्पर्शान्कृत्वा बहिर्बाह्यांश्चक्षुश्चैवान्तरे भ्रुवो: |प्राणापानौ समौ कृत्वा नासाभ्यन्तरचारिणौ || यतेन्द्रियमनोबुद्धिर्मुनिर्मोक्षपरायण: |विगतेच्छाभयक्रोधो य: सदा मुक्त एव स: ||
EN: Shutting out all thoughts of external enjoyment, with the gaze fixed on the space between the eye-brows, equalizing the flow of the incoming and outgoing breath in the nostrils, and thus controlling the senses, mind, and intellect, the sage who becomes free from desire and fear, always lives in freedom.

SA: भोक्तारं यज्ञतपसां सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम् |सुहृदं सर्वभूतानां ज्ञात्वा मां शान्तिमृच्छति ||
EN: Having realized me as the enjoyer of all sacrifices and austerities, the Supreme Lord of all the worlds and the selfless Friend of all living beings, my devotee attains peace.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |अनाश्रित: कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति य: |स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रिय: ||
EN: The Supreme Lord said: Those who perform prescribed duties without desiring the results of their actions are actual sanyāsīs (renunciates) and yogis, not those who have merely ceased performing sacrifices such as agni-hotra yajña or abandoned bodily activities.

SA: यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव |न ह्यसंन्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन ||
EN: What is known as sanyās is non-different from Yog, for none become yogis without renouncing worldly desires.

SA: आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते |योगारूढस्य तस्यैव शम: कारणमुच्यते ||
EN: To the soul who is aspiring for perfection in Yog, work without attachment is said to be the means; to the sage who is already elevated in Yog, tranquility in meditation is said to be the means.

SA: यदा हि नेन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्जते |सर्वसङ्कल्पसंन्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते ||
EN: When one is neither attached to sense objects nor to actions, that person is said to be elevated in the science of Yog, for having renounced all desires for the fruits of actions.

SA: उद्धरेदात्मनात्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् |आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मन: ||
EN: Elevate yourself through the power of your mind, and not degrade yourself, for the mind can be the friend and also the enemy of the self.

SA: बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जित: |अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्ते तात्मैव शत्रुवत् ||
EN: For those who have conquered the mind, it is their friend. For those who have failed to do so, the mind works like an enemy.

SA: जितात्मन: प्रशान्तस्य परमात्मा समाहित: |शीतोष्णसुखदु:खेषु तथा मानापमानयो: ||
EN: The yogis who have conquered the mind rise above the dualities of cold and heat, joy and sorrow, honor and dishonor. Such yogis remain peaceful and steadfast in their devotion to God.

SA: ज्ञानविज्ञानतृप्तात्मा कूटस्थो विजितेन्द्रिय: |युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चन: ||
EN: The yogi who are satisfied by knowledge and discrimination, and have conquered their senses, remain undisturbed in all circumstances. They see everything—dirt, stones, and gold—as the same.

SA: सुहृन्मित्रार्युदासीनमध्यस्थद्वेष्यबन्धुषु |साधुष्वपि च पापेषु समबुद्धिर्विशिष्यते ||
EN: The yogis look upon all—well-wishers, friends, foes, the pious, and the sinners—with an impartial intellect. The yogi who is of equal intellect toward friend, companion, and foe, neutral among enemies and relatives, and impartial between the righteous and sinful, is considered to be distinguished among humans.

SA: योगी युञ्जीत सततमात्मानं रहसि स्थित: |एकाकी यतचित्तात्मा निराशीरपरिग्रह: ||
EN: Those who seek the state of Yog should reside in seclusion, constantly engaged in meditation with a controlled mind and body, getting rid of desires and possessions for enjoyment.

SA: शुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मन: |नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम् ||
EN: To practice Yog, one should make an āsan (seat) in a sanctified place, by placing kuśh grass, deer skin, and a cloth, one over the other. The āsan should be neither too high nor too low.

SA: तत्रैकाग्रं मन: कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रिय: |उपविश्यासने युञ्ज्याद्योगमात्मविशुद्धये || समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिर: |सम्प्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन् ||
EN: Seated firmly on it, the yogi should strive to purify the mind by focusing it in meditation with one pointed concentration, controlling all thoughts and activities. He must hold the body, neck, and head firmly in a straight line, and gaze at the tip of the nose, without allowing the eyes to wander.

SA: तत्रैकाग्रं मन: कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रिय: |उपविश्यासने युञ्ज्याद्योगमात्मविशुद्धये || समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिर: |सम्प्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन् ||
EN: Seated firmly on it, the yogi should strive to purify the mind by focusing it in meditation with one pointed concentration, controlling all thoughts and activities. He must hold the body, neck, and head firmly in a straight line, and gaze at the tip of the nose, without allowing the eyes to wander.

SA: प्रशान्तात्मा विगतभीर्ब्रह्मचारिव्रते स्थित: |मन: संयम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्पर: ||
EN: Thus, with a serene, fearless, and unwavering mind, and staunch in the vow of celibacy, the vigilant yogi should meditate on me, having me alone as the supreme goal.

SA: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी नियतमानस: |शान्तिं निर्वाणपरमां मत्संस्थामधिगच्छति ||
EN: Thus, constantly keeping the mind absorbed in me, the yogi of disciplined mind attains nirvāṇ, and abides in me in supreme peace.

SA: नात्यश्नतस्तु योगोऽस्ति न चैकान्तमनश्नत: |न चाति स्वप्नशीलस्य जाग्रतो नैव चार्जुन ||
EN: O Arjun, those who eat too much or eat too little, sleep too much or too little, cannot attain success in Yog.

SA: युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु |युक्तस्वप्नावबोधस्य योगो भवति दु:खहा ||
EN: But those who are temperate in eating and recreation, balanced in work, and regulated in sleep, can mitigate all sorrows by practicing Yog.

SA: यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते |नि:स्पृह: सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा ||
EN: With thorough discipline, they learn to withdraw the mind from selfish cravings and rivet it on the unsurpassable good of the self. Such persons are said to be in Yog, and are free from all yearning of the senses.

SA: यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता |योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मन: ||
EN: Just as a lamp in a windless place does not flicker, so the disciplined mind of a yogi remains steady in meditation on the self.

SA: यत्रोपरमते चित्तं निरुद्धं योगसेवया |यत्र चैवात्मनात्मानं पश्यन्नात्मनि तुष्यति ||
EN: When the mind, restrained from material activities, becomes still by the practice of Yog, then the yogi is able to behold the soul through the purified mind, and he rejoices in the inner joy.

SA: सुखमात्यन्तिकं यत्तद्बुद्धिग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम् |वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्वत: ||
EN: In that joyous state of Yog, called samādhi, one experiences supreme boundless divine bliss, and thus situated, one never deviates from the Eternal Truth.

SA: यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं तत: |यस्मिन्स्थितो न दु:खेन गुरुणापि विचाल्यते ||
EN: Having gained that state, one does not consider any attainment to be greater. Being thus established, one is not shaken even in the midst of the greatest calamity.

SA: तं विद्याद् दु:खसंयोगवियोगं योगसञ्ज्ञितम् |स निश्चयेन योक्तव्यो योगोऽनिर्विण्णचेतसा ||
EN: That state of severance from union with misery is known as Yog. This Yog should be resolutely practiced with determination free from pessimism.

SA: सङ्कल्पप्रभवान्कामांस्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषत: |मनसैवेन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्तत: || शनै: शनैरुपरमेद्बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया |आत्मसंस्थं मन: कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् ||
EN: Completely renouncing all desires arising from thoughts of the world, one should restrain the senses from all sides with the mind. Slowly and steadily, with conviction in the intellect, the mind will become fixed in God alone, and will think of nothing else.

SA: सङ्कल्पप्रभवान्कामांस्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषत: |मनसैवेन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्तत: || शनै: शनैरुपरमेद्बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया |आत्मसंस्थं मन: कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् ||
EN: Completely renouncing all desires arising from thoughts of the world, one should restrain the senses from all sides with the mind. Slowly and steadily, with conviction in the intellect, the mind will become fixed in God alone, and will think of nothing else.

SA: यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम् |ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत् ||
EN: Whenever and wherever the restless and unsteady mind wanders, one should bring it back and continually focus it on God.

SA: प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम् |उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम् ||
EN: Great transcendental happiness comes to the yogi whose mind is calm, whose passions are subdued, who is without sin, and who sees everything in connection with God.

SA: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मष: |सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्नुते ||
EN: The self-controlled yogi, thus uniting the self with God, becomes free from material contamination, and being in constant touch with the Supreme, achieves the highest state of perfect happiness.

SA: सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि |ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शन: ||
EN: The true yogis, uniting their consciousness with God, see with equal eye, all living beings in God and God in all living beings.

SA: यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति |तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति ||
EN: For those who see me everywhere and see all things in me, I am never lost, nor are they ever lost to me.

SA: सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थित: |सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते ||
EN: The yogi who is established in union with me, and worships me as the Supreme Soul residing in all beings, dwells only in me, though engaged in all kinds of activities.

SA: आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन |सुखं वा यदि वा दु:खं स योगी परमो मत: ||
EN: I regard them to be perfect yogis who see the true equality of all living beings and respond to the joys and sorrows of others as if they were their own.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |योऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्त: साम्येन मधुसूदन |एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम् ||
EN: Arjun said: The system of Yog that you have described, O Madhusudan, appears impractical and unattainable to me, due to the restless mind.

SA: चञ्चलं हि मन: कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद्दृढम् |तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम् ||
EN: The mind is very restless, turbulent, strong and obstinate, O Krishna. It appears to me that it is more difficult to control than the wind.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |असंशयं महाबाहो मनो दुर्निग्रहं चलम् |अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते ||
EN: Lord Krishna said: O mighty-armed son of Kunti, what you say is correct; the mind is indeed very difficult to restrain. But by practice and detachment, it can be controlled.

SA: असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मति: |वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायत: ||
