EN: Yog is difficult to attain for one whose mind is unbridled. However, those who have learnt to control the mind, and who strive earnestly by the proper means, can attain perfection in Yog. This is my opinion.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |अयति: श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्चलितमानस: |अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति ||
EN: Arjun said: What is the fate of the unsuccessful yogi who begins the path with faith, but who does not endeavor sufficiently, due to unsteady mind, and is unable to reach the goal of Yog in this life?

SA: कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति |अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मण: पथि ||
EN: Does not such a person who deviates from Yog get deprived of both material and spiritual success, O mighty-armed Krishna, and perish like a broken cloud with no position in either sphere?

SA: एतन्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषत: |त्वदन्य: संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते ||
EN: O Krishna, please dispel this doubt of mine completely, for who other than you can do so?

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |पार्थ नैवेह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते |न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद्दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति ||
EN: The Supreme Lord said: O Parth, One who engages on the spiritual path does not meet with destruction either in this world or the world to come. My dear friend, one who strives for God-realization is never overcome by evil.

SA: प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वती: समा: |शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते || अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम् |एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम् ||
EN: The unsuccessful yogis, upon death, go to the abodes of the virtuous. After dwelling there for many ages, they are again reborn in the earth plane, into a family of pious and prosperous people. Else, if they had developed dispassion due to long practice of Yog, they are born into a family endowed with divine wisdom. Such a birth is very difficult to attain in this world.

SA: प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वती: समा: |शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते || अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम् |एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम् ||
EN: The unsuccessful yogis, upon death, go to the abodes of the virtuous. After dwelling there for many ages, they are again reborn in the earth plane, into a family of pious and prosperous people. Else, if they had developed dispassion due to long practice of Yog, they are born into a family endowed with divine wisdom. Such a birth is very difficult to attain in this world.

SA: तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम् |यतते च ततो भूय: संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन ||
EN: On taking such a birth, O descendant of Kurus, they reawaken the wisdom of their previous lives, and strive even harder toward perfection in Yog.

SA: पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि स: |जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते ||
EN: Indeed, they feel drawn toward God, even against their will, on the strength of their past discipline. Such seekers naturally rise above the ritualistic principles of the scriptures.

SA: प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संशुद्धकिल्बिष: |अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ||
EN: With the accumulated merits of many past births, when these yogis engage in sincere endeavor in making further progress, they become purified from material desires and attain perfection in this life itself.

SA: तपस्विभ्योऽधिकोयोगीज्ञानिभ्योऽपिमतोऽधिक:|कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिकोयोगीतस्माद्योगीभवार्जुन||
EN: A yogi is superior to the  tapasvī  (ascetic), superior to the  jñānī  (a person of learning), and even superior to the  karmī  (ritualistic performer). Therefore, O Arjun, strive to be a yogi.

SA: योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना |श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मत: ||
EN: Of all yogis, those whose minds are always absorbed in me, and who engage in devotion to me with great faith, them I consider to be the highest of all.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |मय्यासक्तमना: पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रय: |असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु ||
EN: The Supreme Lord said: Now listen, O Arjun, how, with the mind attached exclusively to me, and surrendering to me through the practice of bhakti yog, you can know me completely, free from doubt.

SA: ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषत: |यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते ||
EN: I shall now reveal unto you fully this knowledge and wisdom, knowing which nothing else remains to be known in this world.

SA: मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये |यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्वत: ||
EN: Amongst thousands of persons, hardly one strives for perfection; and amongst those who have achieved perfection, hardly one knows me in truth.

SA: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायु: खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च |अहङ्कार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा ||
EN: Earth, water, fire, air, space, mind, intellect, and ego—these are eight components of my material energy.

SA: अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् |जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत् ||
EN: Such is my inferior energy. But beyond it, O mighty-armed Arjun, I have a superior energy. This is the jīva śhakti (the soul energy), which comprises the embodied souls who are the basis of life in this world.

SA: एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय |अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगत: प्रभव: प्रलयस्तथा ||
EN: Know that all living beings are manifested by these two energies of mine. I am the source of the entire creation, and into me it again dissolves.

SA: मत्त: परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय |मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव ||
EN: There is nothing higher than myself, O Arjun. Everything rests in me, as beads strung on a thread.

SA: रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययो: |प्रणव: सर्ववेदेषु शब्द: खे पौरुषं नृषु ||
EN: I am the taste in water, O son of Kunti, and the radiance of the sun and the moon. I am the sacred syllable Om in the Vedic mantras; I am the sound in ether, and the ability in humans.

SA: पुण्यो गन्ध: पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ |जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु ||
EN: I am the pure fragrance of the Earth, and the brilliance in fire. I am the life-force in all beings, and the penance of the ascetics.

SA: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् |बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ||
EN: O Arjun, know that I am the eternal seed of all beings. I am the intellect of the intelligent, and the splendor of the glorious.

SA: बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम् |धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ ||
EN: O best of the Bharatas, in strong persons, I am their strength devoid of desire and passion. I am sexual activity not conflicting with virtue or scriptural injunctions.

SA: ये चैव सात्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये |मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि ||
EN: The three states of material existence—goodness, passion, and ignorance—are manifested by my energy. They are in me, but I am beyond them.

SA: त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभि: सर्वमिदं जगत् |मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्य: परमव्ययम् ||
EN: Deluded by the three modes of Maya, the people in this world are unable to know me, the imperishable and eternal.

SA: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया |मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते ||
EN: My divine energy Maya, consisting of the three modes of nature, is very difficult to overcome. But those who surrender unto me cross over it easily.

SA: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढा: प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमा: |माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिता: ||
EN: Four kinds of people do not surrender unto me—those ignorant of knowledge, those who lazily follow their lower nature though capable of knowing me, those with deluded intellect, and those with a demoniac nature.

SA: चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जना: सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन |आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ ||
EN: O best amongst the Bharatas, four kinds of pious people engage in my devotion—the distressed, the seekers after knowledge, the seekers of worldly possessions, and those who are situated in knowledge.

SA: तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते |प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रिय: ||
EN: Amongst these, I consider them to be the highest, who worship me with knowledge, and are steadfastly and exclusively devoted to me. I am very dear to them and they are dear to me.

SA: उदारा: सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् |आस्थित: स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम् ||
EN: Indeed, all those who are devoted to me are indeed noble. But those in knowledge, who are of steadfast mind, whose intellect is merged in me, and who have made me alone as their supreme goal, I consider as my very self.

SA: बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते |वासुदेव: सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभ: ||
EN: After many births of spiritual practice, one who is endowed with knowledge surrenders unto me, knowing me to be all that is. Such a great soul is indeed very rare.

SA: कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञाना: प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवता: |तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियता: स्वया ||
EN: Those whose knowledge has been carried away by material desires surrender to the celestial gods. Following their own nature, they worship the devatās, practicing rituals meant to propitiate these celestial personalities.

SA: यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्त: श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति |तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम् ||
EN: Whatever celestial form a devotee seeks to worship with faith, I steady the faith of such a devotee in that form.

SA: स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते |लभते च तत: कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान् ||
EN: Endowed with faith, the devotee worships a particular celestial god and obtains the objects of desire. But in reality I alone arrange these benefits.

SA: अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम् |देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि ||
EN: But the fruit gained by these people of small understanding is perishable. Those who worship the celestial gods go to the celestial abodes, while my devotees come to me.

SA: अव्यक्तं व्यक्तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धय: |परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम् ||
EN: The less intelligent think that I, the Supreme Lord Shree Krishna, was formless earlier and have now assumed this personality. They do not understand the imperishable exalted nature of my personal form.

SA: नाहं प्रकाश: सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृत: |मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम् ||
EN: I am not manifest to everyone, being veiled by my divine Yogmaya energy. Hence, those without knowledge do not know that I am without birth and changeless.

SA: वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन |भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन ||
EN: O Arjun, I know of the the past, present, and future, and I also know all living beings; but me no one knows.

SA: इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत |सर्वभूतानि सम्मोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप ||
EN: O descendant of Bharat, the dualities of desire and aversion arise from illusion. O conqueror of enemies, all living beings in the material realm are from birth deluded by these.

SA: येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम् |ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रता: ||
EN: But persons, whose sins have been destroyed by engaging in pious activities, become free from the illusion of dualities. Such persons worship me with determination.

SA: जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये |ते ब्रह्म तद्विदु: कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम् ||
EN: Those who take shelter in me, striving for liberation from old-age and death, come to know Brahman, the individual self, and the entire field of karmic action.

SA: साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदु: |प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतस: ||
EN: Those who know me as the governing principle of the adhibhūta (field of matter) and the adhidaiva (the celestial gods), and as adhiyajña (the Lord all sacrificial performances), such enlightened souls are in full consciousness of me even at the time of death.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |किं तद्ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम |अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते || अधियज्ञ: कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन |प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभि: ||
EN: Arjun said: O Supreme Lord, what is Brahman (Absolute Reality), what is adhyātma (the individual soul), and what is karma? What is said to be adhibhūta, and who is said to be Adhidaiva? Who is Adhiyajña in the body and how is he the Adhiyajña? O Krishna, how are you to be known at the time of death by those of steadfast mind?

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |किं तद्ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम |अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते || अधियज्ञ: कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन |प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभि: ||
EN: Arjun said: O Supreme Lord, what is Brahman (Absolute Reality), what is adhyātma (the individual soul), and what is karma? What is said to be adhibhūta, and who is said to be Adhidaiva? Who is Adhiyajña in the body and how is he the Adhiyajña? O Krishna, how are you to be known at the time of death by those of steadfast mind?

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते |भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्ग: कर्मसञ्ज्ञित: ||
EN: The Blessed Lord said: The Supreme Indestructible Entity is called Brahman; one’s own self is called adhyātma. Actions pertaining to the material personality of living beings, and its development are called karma, or fruitive activities.

SA: अधिभूतं क्षरो भाव: पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम् |अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर ||
EN: O best of the embodied souls, the physical manifestation that is constantly changing is called adhibhūta; the universal form of God, which presides over the celestial gods in this creation, is called adhidaiva; I, who dwell in the heart of every living being, am called Adhiyajña, or the Lord of all sacrifices.

SA: अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् |य: प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशय: ||
EN: Those who relinquish the body while remembering me at the moment of death will come to me. There is certainly no doubt about this.

SA: यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् |तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावित: ||
EN: Whatever one remembers upon giving up the body at the time of death, O son of Kunti, one attains that state, being always absorbed in such contemplation.

SA: तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च |मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयम् ||
EN: Therefore, always remember me and also do your duty of fighting the war. With mind and intellect surrendered to me, you will definitely attain me; of this, there is no doubt.

SA: अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना |परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन् ||
EN: With practice, O Parth, when you constantly engage the mind in remembering me, the Supreme Divine Personality, without deviating, you will certainly attain me.

SA: कविं पुराणमनुशासितारमणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्य: |सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूपमादित्यवर्णं तमस: परस्तात् || प्रयाणकाले मनसाचलेनभक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव |भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक् स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम् ||
EN: God is omniscient, the most ancient one, the controller, subtler than the subtlest, the support of all, and the possessor of an inconceivable divine form; he is brighter than the sun, and beyond all darkness of ignorance. One who at the time of death, with unmoving mind attained by the practice of Yog, who fixes the prāṇ (life airs) between the eyebrows, and steadily remembers the Divine Lord with great devotion, certainly attains him.

SA: कविं पुराणमनुशासितारमणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्य: |सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूपमादित्यवर्णं तमस: परस्तात् || प्रयाणकाले मनसाचलेनभक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव |भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक् स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम् ||
EN: God is omniscient, the most ancient one, the controller, subtler than the subtlest, the support of all, and the possessor of an inconceivable divine form; he is brighter than the sun, and beyond all darkness of ignorance. One who at the time of death, with unmoving mind attained by the practice of Yog, who fixes the prāṇ (life airs) between the eyebrows, and steadily remembers the Divine Lord with great devotion, certainly attains him.

SA: यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्तिविशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागा: |यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्तितत्ते पदं संग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये ||
EN: Scholars of the Vedas describe him as Imperishable; great ascetics practice the vow of celibacy and renounce worldly pleasures to enter into him. I shall now explain to you briefly the path to that goal.

SA: सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च |मूर्ध्न्याधायात्मन: प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम् ||
EN: Restraining all the gates of the body and fixing the mind in the heart region, and then drawing the life-breath to the head, one should get established in steadfast yogic concentration.

SA: ओमित्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् |य: प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम् ||
EN: One who departs from the body while remembering me, the Supreme Personality, and chanting the syllable Om, will attain the supreme goal.

SA: अनन्यचेता: सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यश: |तस्याहं सुलभ: पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिन: ||
EN: O Parth, for those yogis who always think of me with exclusive devotion, I am easily attainable because of their constant absorption in me.

SA: मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दु:खालयमशाश्वतम् |नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मान: संसिद्धिं परमां गता: ||
EN: Having attained me, the great souls are no more subject to rebirth in this world, which is transient and full of misery, because they have attained the highest perfection.

SA: आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोका: पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन |मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते ||
EN: In all the worlds of this material creation, up to the highest abode of Brahma, you will be subject to rebirth, O Arjun. But on attaining my abode, O son of Kunti, there is no further rebirth.

SA: सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद्ब्रह्मणो विदु: |रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जना: ||
EN: One day of Brahma (kalp) lasts a thousand cycles of the four ages (mahā yug) and his night also extends for the same span of time. The wise who know this understand the reality about day and night.

SA: अव्यक्ताद्व्यक्तय: सर्वा: प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे |रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसञ्ज्ञके ||
EN: At the advent of Brahma’s day, all living beings emanate from the unmanifest source. And at the fall of his night, all embodied beings again merge into their unmanifest source.

SA: भूतग्राम: स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते |रात्र्यागमेऽवश: पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे ||
EN: The multitudes of beings repeatedly take birth with the advent of Brahma’s day, and are reabsorbed on the arrival of the cosmic night, to manifest again automatically on the advent of the next cosmic day.

SA: परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातन: |य: स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति ||
EN: Transcendental to this manifest and unmanifest creation, there is yet another unmanifest eternal dimension. That realm does not cease even when all others do.

SA: अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहु: परमां गतिम् |यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ||
EN: That unmanifest dimension is the supreme goal, and upon reaching it, one never returns to this mortal world. That is my supreme abode.

SA: पुरुष: स पर: पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया |यस्यान्त:स्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् ||
EN: The Supreme Divine Personality is greater than all that exists. Although he is all-pervading and all living beings are situated in him, yet he can be known only through devotion.

SA: यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिन: |प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ || अग्निर्ज्योतिरह: शुक्ल: षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् |तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जना: || धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्ण: षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् |तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते || शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगत: शाश्वते मते |एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुन: ||
EN: I shall now describe to you the different paths of passing away from this world, O best of the Bharatas, one of which leads to liberation and the other leads to rebirth. Those who know the Supreme Brahman, and who depart from this world, during the six months of the sun’s northern course, the bright fortnight of the moon, and the bright part of the day, attain the supreme destination. The practitioners of Vedic rituals, who pass away during the six months of the sun’s southern course, the dark fortnight of the moon, the time of smoke, the night, attain the celestial abodes. After enjoying celestial pleasures, they again return to the earth. These two, bright and dark paths, always exist in this world. The way of light leads to liberation and the way of darkness leads to rebirth.

SA: नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन |तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन ||
EN: Yogis who know the secret of these two paths, O Parth, are never bewildered. Therefore, at all times be situated in Yog (union with God).

SA: वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तप:सु चैवदानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् |अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वायोगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम् ||
EN: The yogis, who know this secret, gain merit far beyond the fruits of Vedic rituals, the study of the Vedas, performance of sacrifices, austerities, and charities. Such yogis reach the Supreme Abode.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे |ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् ||
EN: The Supreme Lord said: O Arjun, because you are not envious of me, I shall now impart to you this very confidential knowledge and wisdom, upon knowing which you will be released from the miseries of material existence.

SA: राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम् |प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुसुखं कर्तुमव्ययम् ||
EN: This knowledge is the king of sciences and the most profound of all secrets. It purifies those who hear it. It is directly realizable, in accordance with dharma, easy to practice, and everlasting in effect.

SA: अश्रद्दधाना: पुरुषा धर्मस्यास्य परन्तप |अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युसंसारवर्त्मनि ||
EN: People who have no faith in this dharma are unable to attain me, O conqueror of enemies. They repeatedly come back to this world in the cycle of birth and death.

SA: मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना |मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थित: ||
EN: This entire cosmic manifestation is pervaded by me in my unmanifest form. All living beings dwell in me, but I do not dwell in them.

SA: न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् |भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावन: ||
EN: And yet, the living beings do not abide in me. Behold the mystery of my divine energy! Although I am the creator and sustainer of all living beings, I am not influenced by them or by material nature.

SA: यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायु: सर्वत्रगो महान् |तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय ||
EN: Know that as the mighty wind blowing everywhere rests always in the sky, likewise all living beings rest always in me.

SA: सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् |कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम् || प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुन: पुन: |भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात् ||
EN: At the end of one kalp, all living beings merge into my primordial material energy. At the beginning of the next creation, O son of Kunti, I manifest them again. Presiding over my material energy, I generate these myriad forms again and again, in accordance with the force of their natures.

SA: सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् |कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम् || प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुन: पुन: |भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात् ||
EN: At the end of one kalp, all living beings merge into my primordial material energy. At the beginning of the next creation, O son of Kunti, I manifest them again. Presiding over my material energy, I generate these myriad forms again and again, in accordance with the force of their natures.

SA: न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय |उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु ||
EN: O conqueror of wealth, none of these actions bind me. I remain like a neutral observer, ever detached from these actions.

SA: मयाध्यक्षेण प्रकृति: सूयते सचराचरम् |हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते ||
EN: Working under my direction, this material energy brings into being all animate and inanimate forms, O son of Kunti. For this reason, the material world undergoes the changes (of creation, maintenance, and dissolution).

SA: अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम् |परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम् ||
EN: When I descend in my personal form deluded persons are unable to recognize me. They do not know the divinity of my personality, as the Supreme Lord of all beings.

SA: मोघाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञाना विचेतस: |राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिता: ||
EN: Bewildered by the material energy, such persons embrace demoniac and atheistic views. In that deluded state, their hopes for welfare are in vain, their fruitive actions are wasted, and their culture of knowledge is baffled.

SA: महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिता: |भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम् ||
EN: But the great souls, who take shelter of my divine energy, O Parth, know me, Lord Krishna, as the origin of all creation. They engage in my devotion with their minds fixed exclusively on me.

SA: सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रता: |नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते ||
EN: Always singing my divine glories, striving with great determination, and humbly bowing down before me, they constantly worship me in loving devotion.

SA: ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते |एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम् ||
EN: Others, engaging in the yajña of cultivating knowledge, worship me by many methods. Some see me as undifferentiated oneness that is non-different from them, while others see me as separate from them. Still others worship me in the infinite manifestations of my cosmic form.

SA: अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञ: स्वधाहमहमौषधम् |मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम् || पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामह: |वेद्यं पवित्रमोङ्कार ऋक्साम यजुरेव च ||
EN: It is I who am the Vedic ritual, I am the sacrifice, and I am the oblation offered to the ancestors. I am the medicinal herb, and I am the Vedic mantra. I am the clarified butter, I am the fire and the act of offering. Of this universe, I am the Father; I am also the Mother, the Sustainer, and the Grandsire. I am the purifier, the goal of knowledge, the sacred syllable Om. I am the Rig Veda, Sama Veda, and the Yajur Veda.

SA: अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञ: स्वधाहमहमौषधम् |मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम् || पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामह: |वेद्यं पवित्रमोङ्कार ऋक्साम यजुरेव च ||
EN: It is I who am the Vedic ritual, I am the sacrifice, and I am the oblation offered to the ancestors. I am the medicinal herb, and I am the Vedic mantra. I am the clarified butter, I am the fire and the act of offering. Of this universe, I am the Father; I am also the Mother, the Sustainer, and the Grandsire. I am the purifier, the goal of knowledge, the sacred syllable Om. I am the Rig Veda, Sama Veda, and the Yajur Veda.

SA: गतिर्भर्ता प्रभु: साक्षी निवास: शरणं सुहृत् |प्रभव: प्रलय: स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम् ||
EN: I am the supreme goal of all living beings, and I am also their sustainer, master, witness, abode, shelter, and friend. I am the origin, end, and resting place of creation; I am the storehouse and eternal seed.

SA: तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णम्युत्सृजामि च |अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन ||
EN: I radiate heat as the sun, and I withhold, as well as send forth rain. I am immortality as well as death personified, O Arjun. I am the spirit as well as matter.

SA: त्रैविद्या मां सोमपा: पूतपापायज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते |ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोकमश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान् ||
EN: Those who are inclined to the fruitive activity described in the Vedas worship me through ritualistic sacrifices. Being purified from sin by drinking the Soma juice, which is the remnant of the yajñas, they seek to go to heaven. By virtue of their pious deeds, they go to the abode of Indra, the king of heaven, and enjoy the pleasures of the celestial gods.

SA: ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालंक्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति |एवं त्रयीधर्ममनुप्रपन्नागतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते ||
EN: When they have enjoyed the vast pleasures of heaven, the stock of their merits being exhausted, they return to the earthly plane. Thus, those who follow the Vedic rituals, desiring objects of enjoyment, repeatedly come and go in this world.

SA: अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जना: पर्युपासते |तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम् ||
EN: There are those who always think of me and engage in exclusive devotion to me. To them, whose minds are always absorbed in me, I provide what they lack and preserve what they already possess.

SA: येऽप्यन्यदेवता भक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विता: |तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम् ||
EN: O son of Kunti, even those devotees who faithfully worship other gods also worship me. But they do so by the wrong method.

SA: अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च |न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते ||
EN: I am the enjoyer and the only Lord of all sacrifices. But those who fail to realize my divine nature must be reborn.

SA: यान्ति देवव्रता देवान्पितॄ न्यान्ति पितृव्रता: |भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम् ||
EN: Worshippers of the celestial gods take birth amongst the celestial gods, worshippers of the ancestors go to the ancestors, worshippers of ghosts take birth amongst such beings, and my devotees come to me alone.

SA: पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति |तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मन: ||
EN: If one offers to me with devotion a leaf, a flower, a fruit, or even water, I delightfully partake of that article offered with love by my devotee in pure consciousness.

SA: यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् |यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम् ||
EN: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer as oblation to the sacred fire, whatever you bestow as a gift, and whatever austerities you perform, O son of Kunti, do them as an offering to me.

SA: शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनै: |संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि ||
EN: By dedicating all your works to me, you will be freed from the bondage of good and bad results. With your mind attached to me through renunciation, you will be liberated and will reach me.

SA: समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रिय: |ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम् ||
EN: I am equally disposed to all living beings; I am neither inimical nor partial to anyone. But the devotees who worship me with love reside in me and I reside in them.

SA: अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक् |साधुरेव स मन्तव्य: सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि स: ||
EN: Even if the vilest sinners worship me with exclusive devotion, they are to be considered righteous, for they have made the proper resolve.

SA: क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति |कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्त: प्रणश्यति ||
EN: Quickly they become virtuous, and attain lasting peace. O son of Kunti, declare it boldly that no devotee of mine is ever lost.

SA: मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्यु: पापयोनय: |स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम् ||
EN: All those who take refuge in me, whatever their birth, race, sex, or caste, even those whom society scorns, will attain the supreme destination.

SA: किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणा: पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा |अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम् ||
EN: What then to speak about kings and sages with meritorious deeds? Therefore, having come to this transient and joyless world, engage in devotion unto me.

SA: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु |मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायण: ||
EN: Always think of me, be devoted to me, worship me, and offer obeisance to me. Having dedicated your mind and body to me, you will certainly come to me.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वच: |यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया ||
EN: The Blessed Lord said: Listen again to my divine teachings, O mighty armed one. Desiring your welfare because you are my beloved friend, I shall reveal them to you.

SA: न मे विदु: सुरगणा: प्रभवं न महर्षय: |अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वश: ||
EN: Neither celestial gods nor the great sages know my origin. I am the source from which the gods and great seers come.

SA: यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् |असम्मूढ: स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापै: प्रमुच्यते ||
EN: Those who know me as unborn and beginningless, and as the Supreme Lord of the universe, they among mortals are free from illusion and released from all evils.

SA: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसम्मोह: क्षमा सत्यं दम: शम: |सुखं दु:खं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च || अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयश: |भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधा: ||
EN: From me alone arise the varieties in the qualities amongst humans, such as intellect, knowledge, clarity of thought, forgiveness, truthfulness, control over the senses and mind, joy and sorrow, birth and death, fear and courage, non-violence, equanimity, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, and infamy.

SA: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसम्मोह: क्षमा सत्यं दम: शम: |सुखं दु:खं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च || अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयश: |भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधा: ||
EN: From me alone arise the varieties in the qualities amongst humans, such as intellect, knowledge, clarity of thought, forgiveness, truthfulness, control over the senses and mind, joy and sorrow, birth and death, fear and courage, non-violence, equanimity, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, and infamy.

SA: महर्षय: सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा |मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमा: प्रजा: ||
EN: The seven great Sages, the four great Saints before them, and the fourteen Manus, are all born from my mind. From them, all the people in the world have descended.

SA: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्वत: |सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशय: ||
EN: Those who know in truth my glories and divine powers become united with me through unwavering bhakti yog. Of this there is no doubt.

SA: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्त: सर्वं प्रवर्तते |इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विता: ||
EN: I am the origin of all creation. Everything proceeds from me. The wise who know this perfectly worship me with great faith and devotion.

SA: मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्त: परस्परम् |कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ||
EN: With their minds fixed on me and their lives surrendered to me, my devotees remain ever contented in me. They derive great satisfaction and bliss in enlightening one another about me, and conversing about my glories.

SA: तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् |ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ||
EN: To those whose minds are always united with me in loving devotion, I give the divine knowledge by which they can attain me.

SA: तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तम: |नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता ||
EN: Out of compassion for them, I, who dwell within their hearts, destroy the darkness born of ignorance, with the luminous lamp of knowledge.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् |पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम् || आहुस्त्वामृषय: सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा |असितो देवलो व्यास: स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे ||
EN: Arjun said: You are the Supreme Divine Personality, the Supreme Abode, the Supreme Purifier, the Eternal God, the Primal Being, the Unborn, and the Greatest. The great sages, like Narad, Asit, Deval, and Vyas, proclaimed this, and now you are declaring it to me yourself.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् |पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम् || आहुस्त्वामृषय: सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा |असितो देवलो व्यास: स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे ||
EN: Arjun said: You are the Supreme Divine Personality, the Supreme Abode, the Supreme Purifier, the Eternal God, the Primal Being, the Unborn, and the Greatest. The great sages, like Narad, Asit, Deval, and Vyas, proclaimed this, and now you are declaring it to me yourself.

SA: सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव |न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवा: ||
EN: O Krishna, I totally accept everything you have told me as the truth. O Lord, neither gods nor the demons can understand your true personality.

SA: स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम |भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते ||
EN: Indeed, you alone know yourself by your inconceivable energy, O Supreme Personality, the Creator and Lord of all beings, the God of gods, and the Lord of the universe!

SA: वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतय: |याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि || कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् |केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया ||
EN: Please describe to me your divine opulences, by which you pervade all the worlds and reside in them. O Supreme Master of Yog, how may I know you and think of you. And while meditating, in what forms can I think of you, O Supreme Divine Personality?

SA: वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतय: |याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि || कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् |केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया ||
EN: Please describe to me your divine opulences, by which you pervade all the worlds and reside in them. O Supreme Master of Yog, how may I know you and think of you. And while meditating, in what forms can I think of you, O Supreme Divine Personality?

SA: विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन |भूय: कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् ||
EN: Tell me again in detail your divine glories and manifestations, O Janardan. I can never tire of hearing your nectar.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतय: |प्राधान्यत: कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे ||
EN: The Blessed Lord spoke: I shall now briefly describe my divine glories to you, O best of the Kurus, for there is no end to their detail.

SA: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थित: |अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ||
EN: O Arjun, I am seated in the heart of all living entities. I am the beginning, middle, and end of all beings.

SA: आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान् |मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी ||
EN: Amongst the twelve sons of Aditi I am Vishnu; amongst luminous objects I am the sun. Know me to be Marichi amongst the Maruts, and the moon amongst the stars in the night sky.

SA: वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासव: |इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना ||
EN: I am the Sāma Veda amongst the Vedas, and Indra amongst the celestial gods. Amongst the senses I am the mind; amongst the living beings I am consciousness.

SA: रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् |वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरु: शिखरिणामहम् ||
EN: Amongst the Rudras know me to be Shankar; amongst the demons I am Kuber. I am Agni amongst the Vasus and Meru amongst the mountains.

SA: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् |सेनानीनामहं स्कन्द: सरसामस्मि सागर: ||
EN: O Arjun, amongst priests I am Brihaspati; amongst warrior chiefs I am Kartikeya; and amongst reservoirs of water know me to be the ocean.

SA: महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् |यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालय: ||
EN: I am Bhrigu amongst the great seers and the transcendental Om amongst sounds. Amongst chants know me to be the repetition of the Holy Name; amongst immovable things I am the Himalayas.

SA: अश्वत्थ: सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारद: |गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथ: सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनि: ||
EN: Amongst trees I am the banyan tree; of the celestial sages I am Narad. Amongst the Gandharvas I am Chitrath, and amongst the siddhas I am the sage Kapil.

SA: उच्चै:श्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम् |ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम् ||
EN: Amongst horses know me to be Ucchaihshrava, begotten from the churning of the ocean of nectar. I am Airavata amongst all lordly elephants, and the king amongst humans.

SA: आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् |प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्प: सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकि: ||
EN: I am the Vajra (thunderbolt) amongst weapons and Kamadhenu amongst the cows. I am Kaamdev, the god of love, amongst all causes for procreation; amongst serpents I am Vasuki.

SA: अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम् |पितृणामर्यमा चास्मि यम: संयमतामहम् ||
EN: Amongst the snakes I am Anant; amongst aquatics I am Varun. Amongst the departed ancestors I am Aryama; amongst dispensers of law I am Yamraj, the lord of death.

SA: प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां काल: कलयतामहम् |मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम् ||
EN: I am Prahlad amongst the demons; amongst all that controls I am time. Know me to be the lion amongst animals, and Garud amongst the birds.

SA: पवन: पवतामस्मि राम: शस्त्रभृतामहम् |झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी ||
EN: Amongst purifiers I am the wind, and amongst wielders of weapons I am Lord Ram. Of water creatures I am the crocodile, and of flowing rivers I am the Ganges.

SA: सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन |अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वाद: प्रवदतामहम् ||
EN: O Arjun, know me to be the beginning, middle, and end of all creation. Amongst sciences I am the science of spirituality, and in debates I am the logical conclusion.

SA: अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्व: सामासिकस्य च |अहमेवाक्षय: कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुख: ||
EN: I am the beginning “A” amongst all letters; I am the dual word in grammatical compounds. I am the endless Time, and amongst creators I am Brahma.

SA: मृत्यु: सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम् |कीर्ति: श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृति: क्षमा ||
EN: I am the all-devouring Death, and I am the origin of those things that are yet to be. Amongst feminine qualities I am fame, prosperity, fine speech, memory, intelligence, courage, and forgiveness.

SA: बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम् |मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकर: ||
EN: Amongst the hymns in the Sāma Veda know me to be the Brihatsama; amongst poetic meters I am the Gayatri. Of the twelve months of the Hindu calendar I am Margsheersh, and of seasons I am spring, which brings forth flowers.

SA: द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् |जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्वं सत्ववतामहम् ||
EN: I am the gambling of the cheats and the splendor of the splendid. I am the victory of the victorious, the resolve of the resolute, and the virtue of the virtuous.

SA: वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनञ्जय: |मुनीनामप्यहं व्यास: कवीनामुशना कवि: ||
EN: Amongst the descendants of Vrishni, I am Krishna, and amongst the Pandavas I am Arjun. Know me to be Ved Vyas amongst the sages, and Shukracharya amongst the great thinkers.

SA: दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम् |मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम् ||
EN: I am just punishment amongst means of preventing lawlessness, and proper conduct amongst those who seek victory. Amongst secrets I am silence, and in the wise I am their wisdom.

SA: यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन |न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम् ||
EN: I am the generating seed of all living beings, O Arjun. No creature moving or non-moving can exist without me.

SA: नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परन्तप |एष तूद्देशत: प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया ||
EN: There is no end to my divine manifestations, O conqueror of enemies. What I have declared to you is a mere sample of my infinite glories.

SA: यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा |तत्देवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसम्भवम् ||
EN: Whatever you see as beautiful, glorious, or powerful, know it to spring from but a spark of my splendor.

SA: अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन |विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत् ||
EN: What need is there for all this detailed knowledge, O Arjun? Simply know that by one fraction of my being, I pervade and support this entire creation.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसञ्ज्ञितम् |यत्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम ||
EN: Arjun said: Having heard the supremely confidential spiritual knowledge, which you have revealed out of compassion to me, my illusion is now dispelled.

SA: भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया |त्वत्त: कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम् ||
EN: I have heard from you in detail about the appearance and disappearance of all living beings, O lotus-eyed one, and also about your eternal majesty.

SA: एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर |द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम ||
EN: O Supreme Lord, you are precisely what you declare yourself to be. Now I desire to see your divine cosmic form, O greatest of persons.

SA: मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो |योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम् ||
EN: O Lord of all mystic powers, if you think I am strong enough to behold it, then kindly reveal that imperishable cosmic form to me.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रश: |नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च ||
EN: The Supreme Lord said: Behold, O Parth, my hundreds and thousands of wonderful forms of various shapes, sizes, and colors.

SA: पश्यादित्यान्वसून् रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा |बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत ||
EN: Behold in me, O scion of the Bharatas, the (twelve) sons of Aditi, the (eight) Vasus, the (eleven) Rudras, the (twin) Ashwini Kumars, as well as the (forty-nine) Maruts and many more marvels never revealed before.

SA: इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम् |मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद्द्रष्टुमिच्छसि ||
EN: Behold now, Arjun, the entire universe, with everything moving and non-moving, assembled together in my universal form. Whatever else you wish to see, observe it all within this universal form.

SA: न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा |दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षु: पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् ||
EN: But you cannot see my cosmic form with these physical eyes of yours. Therefore, I grant you divine vision. Behold my majestic opulence!

SA: सञ्जय उवाच |एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन्महायोगेश्वरो हरि: |दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम् ||
EN: Sanjay said: O King, having spoken thus, the Supreme Lord of Yog, Shree Krishna, displayed his divine and opulent form to Arjun.

SA: अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम् |अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम् || दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम् |सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम् ||
EN: In that cosmic form, Arjun saw unlimited faces and eyes, decorated with many celestial ornaments and wielding many kinds of divine weapons. He wore many garlands on his body and was anointed with many sweet-smelling heavenly fragrances. He revealed himself as the wonderful and infinite Lord whose face is everywhere.

SA: अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम् |अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम् || दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम् |सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम् ||
EN: In that cosmic form, Arjun saw unlimited faces and eyes, decorated with many celestial ornaments and wielding many kinds of divine weapons. He wore many garlands on his body and was anointed with many sweet-smelling heavenly fragrances. He revealed himself as the wonderful and infinite Lord whose face is everywhere.

SA: दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता |यदि भा: सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मन: ||
EN: If a thousand suns were to blaze forth together in the sky, they would not match the splendor of that great form.

SA: तत्रैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तमनेकधा |अपश्यद्देवदेवस्य शरीरे पाण्डवस्तदा ||
EN: There Arjun could see the totality of the entire universe established in one place, in that body of the God of gods.

SA: तत: स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनञ्जय: |प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत ||
EN: Then, Arjun, full of wonder and with hair standing on end, bowed his head with folded hands before the Lord and addressed him thus.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |पश्यामि देवांस्तव देव देहेसर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसङ्घान् |ब्रह्माणमीशं कमलासनस्थ-मृषींश्च सर्वानुरगांश्च दिव्यान् ||
EN: Arjun said: O Shree Krishna, I behold within your body all the gods and hosts of different beings. I see Brahma seated on the lotus flower; I see Shiv, all the sages, and the celestial serpents.

SA: अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रंपश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम् |नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिंपश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप ||
EN: I see your infinite form in every direction, with countless arms, stomachs, faces, and eyes. O Lord of the universe, whose form is the universe itself, I do not see in you any beginning, middle, or end.

SA: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रिणं चतेजोराशिं सर्वतो दीप्तिमन्तम् |पश्यामि त्वां दुर्निरीक्ष्यं समन्ताद्दीप्तानलार्कद्युतिमप्रमेयम् ||
EN: I see your form, adorned with a crown, and armed with the club and disc, shining everywhere as the abode of splendor. It is hard to look upon you in the blazing fire of your effulgence, which is radiating like the sun in all directions.

SA: त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यंत्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् |त्वमव्यय: शाश्वतधर्मगोप्तासनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे ||
EN: I recognize you as the supreme imperishable being, the ultimate truth to be known by the scriptures. You are the support of all creation; you are the eternal protector of sanātan dharma (the eternal religion); and you are the everlasting Supreme Divine Personality.

SA: अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्य-मनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम् |पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्त्रं-
EN: You are without beginning, middle, or end; your power has no limits. Your arms are infinite; the sun and the moon are like your eyes, and fire is like your mouth. I see you warming the entire creation by your radiance.

SA: द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हिव्याप्तं त्वयैकेन दिशश्च सर्वा: |दृष्ट्वाद्भुतं रूपमुग्रं तवेदंलोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितं महात्मन् ||
EN: The space between heaven and earth and all the directions are pervaded by you alone. Seeing your wondrous and terrible form, I see the three worlds trembling in fear, O Greatest of all beings.

SA: अमी हि त्वां सुरसङ्घा विशन्तिकेचिद्भीता: प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति |स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसङ्घा:स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभि: पुष्कलाभि: ||
EN: All the celestial gods are taking your shelter by entering into you. In awe, some are praising you with folded hands. The great sages and perfected beings are extolling you with auspicious hymns and profuse prayers.

SA: रुद्रादित्या वसवो ये च साध्या विश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च |गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसङ्घावीक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे ||
EN: The Rudras, Adityas, Vasus, Sadhyas, Vishvadevas, Ashwini Kumars, Maruts, ancestors, Gandharvas, Yakshas, Asuras, and Siddhas are all beholding you in wonder.

SA: रूपं महत्ते बहुवक्त्रनेत्रंमहाबाहो बहुबाहूरुपादम् |बहूदरं बहुदंष्ट्राकरालंदृष्ट्वा लोका: प्रव्यथितास्तथाहम् ||
EN: O mighty Lord, in veneration of your magnificent form with its many mouths, eyes, arms, thighs, legs, stomachs, and terrifying teeth, all the worlds are terror-stricken, and so am I.

SA: नभ:स्पृशं दीप्तमनेकवर्णंव्यात्ताननं दीप्तविशालनेत्रम् |दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्माधृतिं न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो ||
EN: O Lord Vishnu, seeing your form touching the sky, effulgent in many colors, with mouths wide open and enormous blazing eyes, my heart is trembling with fear. I have lost all courage and peace of mind.

SA: दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानिदृष्ट्वैव कालानलसन्निभानि |दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्मप्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास ||
EN: Having seen your many mouths bearing your terrible teeth, resembling the raging fire at the time of annihilation, I forget where I am and do not know where to go. O Lord of lords, you are the shelter of the universe; please have mercy on me.

SA: अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्रा:सर्वे सहैवावनिपालसङ्घै: |भीष्मो द्रोण: सूतपुत्रस्तथासौसहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यै: || वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्तिदंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि |केचिद्विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषुसन्दृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गै: ||
EN: I see all the sons of Dhritarashtra, along with their allied kings, including Bheeshma, Dronacharya, Karn, and also the generals from our side, rushing headlong into your fearsome mouths. I see some with their heads smashed between your terrible teeth.

SA: अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्रा:सर्वे सहैवावनिपालसङ्घै: |भीष्मो द्रोण: सूतपुत्रस्तथासौसहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यै: || वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्तिदंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि |केचिद्विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषुसन्दृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गै: ||
EN: I see all the sons of Dhritarashtra, along with their allied kings, including Bheeshma, Dronacharya, Karn, and also the generals from our side, rushing headlong into your fearsome mouths. I see some with their heads smashed between your terrible teeth.

SA: यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगा:समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति |तथा तवामी नरलोकवीराविशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति || यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतङ्गाविशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगा: |तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोका-स्तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगा: ||
EN: As many waves of the rivers flowing rapidly into the ocean, so are all these great warriors entering into your blazing mouths. As moths rush with great speed into the fire to perish, so are all these armies entering with great speed into your mouths.

SA: यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगा:समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति |तथा तवामी नरलोकवीराविशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति || यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतङ्गाविशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगा: |तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोका-स्तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगा: ||
EN: As many waves of the rivers flowing rapidly into the ocean, so are all these great warriors entering into your blazing mouths. As moths rush with great speed into the fire to perish, so are all these armies entering with great speed into your mouths.

SA: लेलिह्यसे ग्रसमान: समन्ता-ल्लोकान्समग्रान्वदनैर्ज्वलद्भि: |तेजोभिरापूर्य जगत्समग्रंभासस्तवोग्रा: प्रतपन्ति विष्णो ||
EN: With your fiery tongues you are licking up the hosts of living beings on all sides and devouring them with your blazing mouths. O Vishnu, you are scorching the entire universe with the fierce, all-pervading rays of your effulgence.

SA: आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपोनमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद |विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्तमाद्यंन हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम् ||
EN: Tell me who you are, so fierce of form. O God of gods, I bow before you; please bestow your mercy on me. You, who existed before all creation, I wish to know who you are, for I do not comprehend your nature and workings.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धोलोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्त: |ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वेयेऽवस्थिता: प्रत्यनीकेषु योधा: ||
EN: The Supreme Lord said: I am mighty Time, the source of destruction that comes forth to annihilate the worlds. Even without your participation, the warriors arrayed in the opposing army shall cease to exist.

SA: तस्मात्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्वजित्वा शत्रून्भुङ् क्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम् |मयैवैते निहता: पूर्वमेवनिमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन् ||
EN: Therefore, arise and attain honor! Conquer your foes and enjoy prosperous rulership. These warriors stand already slain by me, and you will only be an instrument of my work, O expert archer.

SA: द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं चकर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान् |मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठायुध्यस्व जेतासि रणे सपत्नान् ||
EN: Dronacharya, Bheeshma, Jayadratha, Karn, and other brave warriors have already been killed by me. So slay them without being disturbed. Just fight and you will be victorious over your enemies in battle.

SA: सञ्जय उवाच |एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्यकृताञ्जलिर्वेपमान: किरीटी |नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णंसगद्गदं भीतभीत: प्रणम्य ||
EN: Sanjay said: Hearing these words of Keshav, Arjun trembled with dread. With palms joined, he bowed before Shree Krishna and spoke in a faltering voice, overwhelmed with fear.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |स्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्याजगत्प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यते च |रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्तिसर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसङ्घा: ||
EN: Arjun said: O Master of the senses, it is but apt that the universe rejoices in giving you praise and is enamored by You. Demons flee fearfully from you in all directions and the hosts of perfected saints bow to you.

SA: कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन्महात्मन्गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकर्त्रे |अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवासत्वमक्षरं सदसतत्परं यत् ||
EN: O Great one, who are even greater than Brahma, the original creator, why should they not bow to you? O limitless One, O Lord of the devatās, O Refuge of the universe, you are the imperishable reality beyond both the manifest and the non-manifest.

SA: त्वमादिदेव: पुरुष: पुराण-स्त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् |वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धामत्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप ||
EN: You are the primeval God and the original Divine Personality; you are the sole resting place of this universe. You are both the knower and the object of knowledge; you are the Supreme Abode. O possessor of infinite forms, you alone pervade the entire universe.

SA: वायुर्यमोऽग्निर्वरुण: शशाङ्क:प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च |नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्व:पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते ||
EN: You are Vāyu (the god of wind), Yamraj (the god of death), Agni (the god of fire), Varuṇ (the god of water), and Chandra (the moon-God). You are the creator Brahma, and the great-grandfather of all beings. I offer my salutations unto you a thousand times, again and yet again!

SA: नम: पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतस्तेनमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व |अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वंसर्वं समाप्नोषि ततोऽसि सर्व: ||
EN: O Lord of infinite power, my salutations to you from the front and the rear, indeed from all sides! You possess infinite valor and might and pervade everything, and thus, you are everything.

SA: सखेति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तं हे कृष्ण हे यादव हे सखेति |अजानता महिमानं तवेदंमया प्रमादात्प्रणयेन वापि || यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसिविहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु |एकोऽथवाप्यच्युत तत्समक्षंतत्क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम् ||
EN: Thinking of you as my friend, I presumptuously addressed you as, “O Krishna,” “O Yadav,” “O my dear mate.” I was ignorant of your majesty, showing negligence and undue affection. And if, jestfully, I treated you with disrespect, while playing, resting, sitting, eating, when alone, or before others—for all that I crave forgiveness.

SA: सखेति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तं हे कृष्ण हे यादव हे सखेति |अजानता महिमानं तवेदंमया प्रमादात्प्रणयेन वापि || यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसिविहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु |एकोऽथवाप्यच्युत तत्समक्षंतत्क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम् ||
EN: Thinking of you as my friend, I presumptuously addressed you as, “O Krishna,” “O Yadav,” “O my dear mate.” I was ignorant of your majesty, showing negligence and undue affection. And if, jestfully, I treated you with disrespect, while playing, resting, sitting, eating, when alone, or before others—for all that I crave forgiveness.

SA: पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्यत्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरुर्गरीयान् |न त्वत्समोऽस्त्यभ्यधिक: कुतोऽन्योलोकत्रयेऽप्यप्रतिमप्रभाव ||
EN: You are the father of the entire universe, of all moving and non-moving beings. You are the most deserving of worship and the supreme spiritual master. When there is none equal to you in all the three worlds, then who can possibly be greater than you, O possessor of incomparable power?

SA: तस्मात्प्रणम्य प्रणिधाय कायंप्रसादये त्वामहमीशमीड्यम् |पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्यु:प्रिय: प्रियायार्हसि देव सोढुम् ||
EN: Therefore, O adorable Lord, bowing deeply and prostrating before you, I implore you for your grace. As a father tolerates his son, a friend forgives his friend, and a lover pardons the beloved, please forgive me for my offences.

SA: अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषितोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वाभयेन च प्रव्यथितं मनो मे |तदेव मे दर्शय देवरूपंप्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास ||
EN: Having seen your universal form that I had never seen before, I feel great joy. And yet, my mind trembles with fear. Please have mercy on me and again show me your pleasing form, O God of gods, O abode of the universe.

SA: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्त-मिच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव |तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेनसहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते ||
EN: O thousand-armed one, though you are the embodiment of all creation, I wish to see you in your four-armed form, carrying the mace and disc, and wearing the crown.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदंरूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात् |तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यंयन्मे त्वदन्येन न दृष्टपूर्वम् ||
EN: The Blessed Lord said: Arjun, being pleased with you, by my Yogmaya power, I gave you a vision of my resplendent, unlimited, and primeval cosmic form. No one before you has ever seen it.

SA: न वेदयज्ञाध्ययनैर्न दानै-र्न च क्रियाभिर्न तपोभिरुग्रै: |एवंरूप: शक्य अहं नृलोकेद्रष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर ||
EN: Not by study of the Vedas, nor by the performance of sacrifice, rituals, or charity, nor even by practicing severe austerities, has any mortal ever seen what you have seen, O best of the Kuru warriors.

SA: मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावोदृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्ममेदम् |व्यपेतभी: प्रीतमना: पुनस्त्वंतदेव मे रूपमिदं प्रपश्य ||
EN: Be neither afraid nor bewildered on seeing this terrible form of mine. Be free from fear and with a cheerful heart, behold me once again in my personal form.

SA: सञ्जय उवाच |इत्यर्जुनं वासुदेवस्तथोक्त्वास्वकं रूपं दर्शयामास भूय: |आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनंभूत्वा पुन: सौम्यवपुर्महात्मा ||
EN: Sanjay said: Having spoken thus, the compassionate son of Vasudev displayed his personal (four-armed) form again. Then, he further consoled the frightened Arjun by assuming his gentle (two-armed) form.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन |इदानीमस्मि संवृत्त: सचेता: प्रकृतिं गत: ||
EN: Arjun said: O Shree Krishna, seeing your gentle human form (two-armed), I have regained my composure and my mind is restored to normal.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |सुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम |देवा अप्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्क्षिण: || नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया |शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा ||
EN: The Supreme Lord said: This form of mine that you are seeing is exceedingly difficult to behold. Even the celestial gods are eager to see it. Neither by the study of the Vedas, nor by penance, charity, or fire sacrifices, can I be seen as you have seen me.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |सुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम |देवा अप्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्क्षिण: || नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया |शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा ||
EN: The Supreme Lord said: This form of mine that you are seeing is exceedingly difficult to behold. Even the celestial gods are eager to see it. Neither by the study of the Vedas, nor by penance, charity, or fire sacrifices, can I be seen as you have seen me.

SA: भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन |ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परन्तप ||
EN: O Arjun, by unalloyed devotion alone can I be known as I am, standing before you. Thereby, on receiving my divine vision, O scorcher of foes, one can enter into union with me.

SA: मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्त: सङ्गवर्जित: |निर्वैर: सर्वभूतेषु य: स मामेति पाण्डव ||
EN: Those who perform all their duties for my sake, who depend upon me and are devoted to me, who are free from attachment, and are without malice toward all beings, such devotees certainly come to me.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |एवं सततयुक्ता ये भक्तास्त्वां पर्युपासते |ये चाप्यक्षरमव्यक्तं तेषां के योगवित्तमा: ||
EN: Arjun inquired: Between those who are steadfastly devoted to your personal form and those who worship the formless Brahman, who do you consider to be more perfect in Yog?

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते |श्रद्धया परयोपेतास्ते मे युक्ततमा मता: ||
EN: The Blessed Lord said: Those who fix their minds on me and always engage in my devotion with steadfast faith, I consider them to be the best yogis.

SA: ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते |सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यञ्च कूटस्थमचलन्ध्रुवम् || सन्नियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धय: |ते प्राप्नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रता: ||
EN: But those who worship the formless aspect of the Absolute Truth—the imperishable, the indefinable, the unmanifest, the all-pervading, the unthinkable, the unchanging, the eternal, and the immoveable—by restraining their senses and being even-minded everywhere, such persons, engaged in the welfare of all beings, also attain me.

SA: ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते |सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यञ्च कूटस्थमचलन्ध्रुवम् || सन्नियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धय: |ते प्राप्नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रता: ||
EN: But those who worship the formless aspect of the Absolute Truth—the imperishable, the indefinable, the unmanifest, the all-pervading, the unthinkable, the unchanging, the eternal, and the immoveable—by restraining their senses and being even-minded everywhere, such persons, engaged in the welfare of all beings, also attain me.

SA: क्लेशोऽधिकतरस्तेषामव्यक्तासक्तचेतसाम् ||अव्यक्ता हि गतिर्दु:खं देहवद्भिरवाप्यते ||
EN: For those whose minds are attached to the unmanifest, the path of realization is full of tribulations. Worship of the unmanifest is exceedingly difficult for embodied beings.

SA: ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्न्यस्य मत्पर: |अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते || तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात् |भवामि नचिरात्पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम् ||
EN: But those who dedicate all their actions to me, regarding me as the Supreme goal, worshiping me and meditating on me with exclusive devotion, O Parth, I swiftly deliver them from the ocean of birth and death, for their consciousness is united with me.

SA: ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्न्यस्य मत्पर: |अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते || तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात् |भवामि नचिरात्पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम् ||
EN: But those who dedicate all their actions to me, regarding me as the Supreme goal, worshiping me and meditating on me with exclusive devotion, O Parth, I swiftly deliver them from the ocean of birth and death, for their consciousness is united with me.

SA: मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय |निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशय: ||
EN: Fix your mind on me alone and surrender your intellect to me. There upon, you will always live in me. Of this, there is no doubt.

SA: अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम् |अभ्यासयोगेन ततो मामिच्छाप्तुं धनञ्जय ||
EN: If you are unable to fix your mind steadily on me, O Arjun, then practice remembering me with devotion while constantly restraining the mind from worldly affairs.

SA: अभ्यासेऽप्यसमर्थोऽसि मत्कर्मपरमो भव |मदर्थमपि कर्माणि कुर्वन्सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि ||
EN: If you cannot practice remembering me with devotion, then just try to work for me. Thus performing devotional service to me, you shall achieve the stage of perfection.

SA: अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रित: |सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं तत: कुरु यतात्मवान् ||
EN: If you are unable to even work for me in devotion, then try to renounce the fruits of your actions and be situated in the self.

SA: श्रेयो हि ज्ञानमभ्यासाज्ज्ञानाद्ध्यानं विशिष्यते |ध्यानात्कर्मफलत्यागस्त्यागाच्छान्तिरनन्तरम् ||
EN: Better than mechanical practice is knowledge; better than knowledge is meditation. Better than meditation is renunciation of the fruits of actions, for peace immediately follows such renunciation.

SA: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्र: करुण एव च |निर्ममो निरहङ्कार: समदु:खसुख: क्षमी || सन्तुष्ट: सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चय: |मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्त: स मे प्रिय: ||
EN: Those devotees are very dear to me who are free from malice toward all living beings, who are friendly, and compassionate. They are free from attachment to possessions and egotism, equipoised in happiness and distress, and ever-forgiving. They are ever-contented, steadily united with me in devotion, self-controlled, firm in conviction, and dedicated to me in mind and intellect.

SA: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्र: करुण एव च |निर्ममो निरहङ्कार: समदु:खसुख: क्षमी || सन्तुष्ट: सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चय: |मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्त: स मे प्रिय: ||
EN: Those devotees are very dear to me who are free from malice toward all living beings, who are friendly, and compassionate. They are free from attachment to possessions and egotism, equipoised in happiness and distress, and ever-forgiving. They are ever-contented, steadily united with me in devotion, self-controlled, firm in conviction, and dedicated to me in mind and intellect.

SA: यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च य: |हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो य: स च मे प्रिय: ||
EN: Those who are not a source of annoyance to anyone and who in turn are not agitated by anyone, who are equal in pleasure and pain, and free from fear and anxiety, such devotees of mine are very dear to me.

SA: अनपेक्ष: शुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथ: |सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्त: स मे प्रिय: ||
EN: Those who are indifferent to worldly gain, externally and internally pure, skillful, without cares, untroubled, and free from selfishness in all undertakings, such devotees of mine are very dear to me.

SA: यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ् क्षति |शुभाशुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान्य: स मे प्रिय: ||
EN: Those who neither rejoice in mundane pleasures nor despair in worldly sorrows, who neither lament for any loss nor hanker for any gain, who renounce both good and evil deeds, such persons who are full of devotion are very dear to me.

SA: सम: शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयो: |शीतोष्णसुखदु:खेषु सम: सङ्गविवर्जित: || तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येन केनचित् |अनिकेत: स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नर: ||
EN: Those, who are alike to friend and foe, equipoised in honor and dishonor, cold and heat, joy and sorrow, and are free from all unfavorable association; those who take praise and reproach alike, who are given to silent contemplation, content with what comes their way, without attachment to the place of residence, whose intellect is firmly fixed in me, and who are full of devotion to me, such persons are very dear to me.

SA: सम: शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयो: |शीतोष्णसुखदु:खेषु सम: सङ्गविवर्जित: || तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येन केनचित् |अनिकेत: स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नर: ||
EN: Those, who are alike to friend and foe, equipoised in honor and dishonor, cold and heat, joy and sorrow, and are free from all unfavorable association; those who take praise and reproach alike, who are given to silent contemplation, content with what comes their way, without attachment to the place of residence, whose intellect is firmly fixed in me, and who are full of devotion to me, such persons are very dear to me.

SA: ये तु धर्म्यामृतमिदं यथोक्तं पर्युपासते |श्रद्दधाना मत्परमा भक्तास्तेऽतीव मे प्रिया: ||
EN: Those who honor this nectar of wisdom declared here, have faith in me, and are devoted and intent on me as the supreme goal, they are exceedingly dear to me.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञमेव च |एतद्वेदितुमिच्छामि ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं च केशव || *
EN: Arjun said, “O Keshav, I wish to understand what are prakṛiti and puruṣh, and what are kṣhetra and kṣhetrajña? I also wish to know what is true knowledge, and what is the goal of this knowledge?

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते |एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहु: क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विद: ||
EN: The Supreme Divine Lord said: O Arjun, this body is termed as kṣhetra (the field of activities), and the one who knows this body is called kṣhetrajña (the knower of the field) by the sages who discern the truth about both.

SA: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत |क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम ||
EN: O scion of Bharat, I am also the knower of all the individual fields of activity. The understanding of the body as the field of activities, and the soul and God as the knowers of the field, this I hold to be true knowledge.

SA: तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् |स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु ||
EN: Listen and I will explain to you what that field is and what its nature is. I will also explain how change takes place within it, from what it was created, who the knower of the field of activities is, and what his powers are.

SA: ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधै: पृथक् |ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चितै: ||  ||
EN: Great sages have sung the truth about the field and the knower of the field in manifold ways. It has been stated in various Vedic hymns, and especially revealed in the Brahma Sūtra, with sound logic and conclusive evidence.

SA: महाभूतान्यङ्ककारो बुद्धिरव्यक्त मेव च |इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचरा: ||
EN: The field of activities is composed of the five great elements, the ego, the intellect, the unmanifest primordial matter, the eleven senses (five knowledge senses, five working senses, and mind), and the five objects of the senses.

SA: इच्छा द्वेष: सुखं दु:खं सङ्घातश्चेतना धृति: |एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम् ||
EN: Desire and aversion, happiness and misery, the body, consciousness, and the will—all these comprise the field and its modifications.

SA: अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम् |आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रह: || इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहङ्कार एव च |जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदु:खदोषानुदर्शनम् || असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्ग: पुत्रदारगृहादिषु |नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु || मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी |विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि || अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम् |एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा ||
EN: Humbleness; freedom from hypocrisy; non-violence; forgiveness; simplicity; service of the Guru; cleanliness of body and mind; steadfastness; and self-control; dispassion toward the objects of the senses; absence of egotism; keeping in mind the evils of birth, disease, old age, and death; non-attachment; absence of clinging to spouse, children, home, and so on; even-mindedness amidst desired and undesired events in life; constant and exclusive devotion toward me; an inclination for solitary places and an aversion for mundane society; constancy in spiritual knowledge; and philosophical pursuit of the Absolute Truth—all these I declare to be knowledge, and what is contrary to it, I call ignorance.
