SA: ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वामृतमश्रुते |अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते ||
EN: I shall now reveal to you that which ought to be known, and by knowing which, one attains immortality. It is the beginningless Brahman, which lies beyond existence and non-existence.

SA: सर्वत: पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम् |सर्वत: श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति ||
EN: Everywhere are his hands and feet, eyes, heads, and faces. His ears too are in all places, for he pervades everything in the universe.

SA: सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम् |असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च ||
EN: Though he perceives all sense-objects, yet he is devoid of the senses. He is unattached to anything, and yet he is the sustainer of all. Although he is without attributes, yet he is the enjoyer of the three modes of material nature.

SA: बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च |सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत् ||
EN: He exists outside and inside all living beings, those that are moving and not moving. He is subtle, and hence, he is incomprehensible. He is very far, but he is also very near.

SA: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् |भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च ||
EN: He is indivisible, yet he appears to be divided amongst living beings. Know the Supreme Entity to be the sustainer, annihilator, and creator of all beings.

SA: ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमस: परमुच्यते |ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम् ||
EN: He is the source of light in all luminaries, and is entirely beyond the darkness of ignorance. He is knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the goal of knowledge. He dwells within the hearts of all living beings.

SA: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासत: |मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते ||
EN: I have thus revealed to you the nature of the field, the meaning of knowledge, and the object of knowledge. Only my devotees can understand this in reality, and by doing so, they attain my divine nature.

SA: प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि |विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भवान् ||
EN: Know that prakṛiti (material nature) and puruṣh (the individual souls) are both beginningless. Also know that all transformations of the body and the three modes of nature are produced by material energy.

SA: कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतु: प्रकृतिरुच्यते |पुरुष: सुखदु:खानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते ||
EN: In the matter of creation, the material energy is responsible for cause and effect; in the matter of experiencing happiness and distress, the individual soul is declared responsible.

SA: पुरुष: प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङक्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान् |कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु ||
EN: When the puruṣh (individual soul) seated in prakṛiti (the material energy) desires to enjoy the three guṇas, attachment to them becomes the cause of its birth in superior and inferior wombs.

SA: उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वर: |परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुष: पर: ||
EN: Within the body also resides the Supreme Lord. He is said to be the witness, the permitter, the supporter, transcendental enjoyer, the ultimate controller, and the Paramātmā (Supreme Soul).

SA: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणै: सह |सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते ||
EN: Those who understand the truth about Supreme Soul, the individual soul, material nature, and the interaction of the three modes of nature will not take birth here again. They will be liberated regardless of their present condition.

SA: ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना |अन्ये साङ् ख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे ||
EN: Some try to perceive the Supreme Soul within their hearts through meditation, and others try to do so through the cultivation of knowledge, while still others strive to attain that realization by the path of action.

SA: अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्त: श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते |तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणा: ||
EN: There are still others who are unaware of these spiritual paths, but they hear from others and begin worshipping the Supreme Lord. By such devotion to hearing from saints, they too can gradually cross over the ocean of birth and death.

SA: यावत्सञ्जायते किञ्चित्सत्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम् |क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ ||
EN: O best of the Bharatas, whatever moving or unmoving being you see in existence, know it to be a combination of the field of activities and the knower of the field.

SA: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् |विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं य: पश्यति स पश्यति ||
EN: They alone truly see, who perceive the Paramātmā (Supreme soul) accompanying the soul in all beings, and who understand both to be imperishable in this perishable body.

SA: समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् |न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम् ||
EN: Those, who see God as the Supreme soul equally present everywhere and in all living beings, do not degrade themselves by their mind. Thereby, they reach the supreme destination.

SA: प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वश: |य: पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति ||
EN: They alone truly see who understand that all actions (of the body) are performed by material nature, while the embodied soul actually does nothing.

SA: यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति |तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा ||
EN: When they see the diverse variety of living beings situated in the same material nature, and understand all of them to be born from it, they attain the realization of Brahman.

SA: अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्यय: |शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते ||
EN: The Supreme soul is imperishable, without beginning, and devoid of any material qualities, O son of Kunti. Although situated within the body, it neither acts, nor is it tainted by material energy.

SA: यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते |सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते ||
EN: Space holds everything within it, but being subtle, does not get contaminated by what it holds. Similarly, though its consciousness pervades the body, the soul is not affected by the attributes of the body.

SA: यथा प्रकाशयत्येक: कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रवि: |क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत ||
EN: Just as one sun illumines the entire solar system, so does the individual soul illumine the entire body (with consciousness).

SA: क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा |भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम् ||
EN: Those who perceive with the eyes of knowledge the difference between the body and the knower of the body, and the process of release from material nature, attain the supreme destination.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |परं भूय: प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम् |यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनय: सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गता: ||
EN: The Divine Lord said: I shall once again explain to you the supreme wisdom, the best of all knowledge; by knowing which, all the great saints attained the highest perfection.

SA: इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागता: |सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च ||
EN: Those who take refuge in this wisdom will be united with me. They will not be reborn at the time of creation nor destroyed at the time of dissolution.

SA: मम योनिर्महद् ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम् |सम्भव: सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत || सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तय: सम्भवन्ति या: |तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रद: पिता ||
EN: The total material substance, prakṛiti, is the womb. I impregnate it with the individual souls, and thus all living beings are born. O son of Kunti, for all species of life that are produced, the material nature is the womb, and I am the seed-giving Father.

SA: मम योनिर्महद् ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम् |सम्भव: सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत || सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तय: सम्भवन्ति या: |तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रद: पिता ||
EN: The total material substance, prakṛiti, is the womb. I impregnate it with the individual souls, and thus all living beings are born. O son of Kunti, for all species of life that are produced, the material nature is the womb, and I am the seed-giving Father.

SA: सत्वं रजस्तम इति गुणा: प्रकृतिसम्भवा: |निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम् ||
EN: O mighty-armed Arjun, the material energy consists of three guṇas (modes)—sattva (goodness), rajas (passion), and tamas (ignorance). These modes bind the eternal soul to the perishable body.

SA: तत्र सत्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम् |सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ ||
EN: Amongst these, sattva guṇa, the mode of goodness, being purer than the others, is illuminating and full of well-being. O sinless one, it binds the soul by creating attachment for a sense of happiness and knowledge.

SA: रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम् | तन्निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम् ||
EN: O Arjun, rajo guṇa is of the nature of passion. It arises from worldly desires and affections, and binds the soul through attachment to fruitive actions.

SA: तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम् |प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्नाति भारत ||
EN: O Arjun, tamo guṇa, which is born of ignorance, is the cause of illusion for the embodied souls. It deludes all living beings through negligence, laziness, and sleep.

SA: सत्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रज: कर्मणि भारत |ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तम: प्रमादे सञ्जयत्युत ||
EN: Sattva binds one to material happiness; rajas conditions the soul toward actions; and tamas clouds wisdom and binds one to delusion.

SA: रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्वं भवति भारत |रज: सत्वं तमश्चैव तम: सत्वं रजस्तथा ||
EN: Sometimes goodness (sattva) prevails over passion (rajas) and ignorance (tamas), O scion of Bharat. Sometimes passion (rajas) dominates goodness (sattva) and ignorance (tamas), and at other times ignorance (tamas) overcomes goodness (sattva) and passion (rajas).

SA: सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते |ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्वमित्युत || लोभ: प्रवृत्तिरारम्भ: कर्मणामशम: स्पृहा |रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ || अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च |तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन ||
EN: When all the gates of the body are illumined by knowledge, know it to be a manifestation of the mode of goodness. When the mode of passion predominates, O Arjun, the symptoms of greed, exertion for worldly gain, restlessness, and craving develop. O Arjun, nescience, inertia, negligence, and delusion—these are the dominant signs of the mode of ignorance.

SA: सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते |ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्वमित्युत || लोभ: प्रवृत्तिरारम्भ: कर्मणामशम: स्पृहा |रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ || अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च |तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन ||
EN: When all the gates of the body are illumined by knowledge, know it to be a manifestation of the mode of goodness. When the mode of passion predominates, O Arjun, the symptoms of greed, exertion for worldly gain, restlessness, and craving develop. O Arjun, nescience, inertia, negligence, and delusion—these are the dominant signs of the mode of ignorance.

SA: सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते |ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्वमित्युत || लोभ: प्रवृत्तिरारम्भ: कर्मणामशम: स्पृहा |रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ || अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च |तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन ||

When the mode of passion predominates, O Arjun, the symptoms of greed, exertion for worldly gain, restlessness, and craving develop. O Arjun, nescience, inertia, negligence, and delusion—these are the dominant signs of the mode of ignorance.

SA: यदा सत्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् |तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते || रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते |तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते ||
EN: Those who die with predominance of sattva reach the pure abodes (which are free from rajas and tamas) of the learned. Those who die with prevalence of the mode of passion are born among people driven by work, while those dying in the mode of ignorance take birth in the animal kingdom.

SA: यदा सत्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् |तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते || रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते |तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते ||
EN: Those who die with predominance of sattva reach the pure abodes (which are free from rajas and tamas) of the learned. Those who die with prevalence of the mode of passion are born among people driven by work, while those dying in the mode of ignorance take birth in the animal kingdom.

SA: कर्मण: सुकृतस्याहु: सात्विकं निर्मलं फलम् |रजसस्तु फलं दु:खमज्ञानं तमस: फलम् ||
EN: It is said the fruit of actions performed in the mode of goodness bestow pure results. Actions done in the mode of passion result in pain, while those performed in the mode of ignorance result in darkness.

SA: सत्वात्सञ्जायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च |प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च ||
EN: From the mode of goodness arises knowledge, from the mode of passion arises greed, and from the mode of ignorance arise negligence and delusion.

SA: ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसा: |जघन्यगुणवृत्तिस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसा: ||
EN: Those situated in the mode of goodness rise upward; those in the mode of passion stay in the middle; and those in the mode of ignorance go downward.

SA: नान्यं गुणेभ्य: कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति |गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भावं सोऽधिगच्छति ||
EN: When wise persons see that in all works there are no agents of action other than the three guṇas, and they know me to be transcendental to these guṇas, they attain my divine nature.

SA: गुणानेतानतीत्य त्रीन्देही देहसमुद्भवान् |जन्ममृत्युजरादु:खैर्विमुक्तोऽमृतमश्रुते ||
EN: By transcending the three modes of material nature associated with the body, one becomes free from birth, death, disease, old age, and misery, and attains immortality.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |कैर्लिङ्गैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो |किमाचार: कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते ||
EN: Arjun inquired: What are the characteristics of those who have gone beyond the three guṇas, O Lord? How do they act? How do they go beyond the bondage of the guṇas?

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव |न द्वेष्टि सम्प्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ् क्षति || उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते |गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येवं योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते ||
EN: The Supreme Divine Personality said: O Arjun, The persons who are transcendental to the three guṇas neither hate illumination (which is born of sattva), nor activity (which is born of rajas), nor even delusion (which is born of tamas), when these are abundantly present, nor do they long for them when they are absent. They remain neutral to the modes of nature and are not disturbed by them. Knowing it is only the guṇas that act, they stay established in the self, without wavering.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव |न द्वेष्टि सम्प्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ् क्षति || उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते |गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येवं योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते ||
EN: The Supreme Divine Personality said: O Arjun, The persons who are transcendental to the three guṇas neither hate illumination (which is born of sattva), nor activity (which is born of rajas), nor even delusion (which is born of tamas), when these are abundantly present, nor do they long for them when they are absent. They remain neutral to the modes of nature and are not disturbed by them. Knowing it is only the guṇas that act, they stay established in the self, without wavering.

SA: समदु:खसुख: स्वस्थ: समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चन: |तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुति: || मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयो: |सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीत: स उच्यते ||
EN: Those who are alike in happiness and distress; who are established in the self; who look upon a clod, a stone, and a piece of gold as of equal value; who remain the same amidst pleasant and unpleasant events; who are intelligent; who accept both blame and praise with equanimity; who remain the same in honor and dishonor; who treat both friend and foe alike; and who have abandoned all enterprises – they are said to have risen above the three guṇas.

SA: समदु:खसुख: स्वस्थ: समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चन: |तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुति: || मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयो: |सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीत: स उच्यते ||
EN: Those who are alike in happiness and distress; who are established in the self; who look upon a clod, a stone, and a piece of gold as of equal value; who remain the same amidst pleasant and unpleasant events; who are intelligent; who accept both blame and praise with equanimity; who remain the same in honor and dishonor; who treat both friend and foe alike; and who have abandoned all enterprises – they are said to have risen above the three guṇas.

SA: मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते |स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ||
EN: Those who serve me with unalloyed devotion rise above the three modes of material nature and come to the level of Brahman.

SA: ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च |शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च ||
EN: I am the basis of the formless Brahman, the immortal and imperishable, of eternal dharma, and of unending divine bliss.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |ऊर्ध्वमूलमध:शाखमश्वत्थं प्राहुरव्ययम् |छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित् ||
EN: The Supreme Divine Personality said: They speak of an eternal aśhvatth tree with its roots above and branches below. Its leaves are the Vedic hymns, and one who knows the secret of this tree is the knower of the Vedas.

SA: अधश्चोर्ध्वं प्रसृतास्तस्य शाखागुणप्रवृद्धा विषयप्रवाला: |अधश्च मूलान्यनुसन्ततानिकर्मानुबन्धीनि मनुष्यलोके ||
EN: The branches of the tree extend upward and downward, nourished by the three guṇas, with the objects of the senses as tender buds. The roots of the tree hang downward, causing the flow of karma in the human form. Below, its roots branch out causing (karmic) actions in the world of humans.

SA: न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यतेनान्तो न चादिर्न च सम्प्रतिष्ठा |अश्वत्थमेनं सुविरूढमूलमसङ्गशस्त्रेण दृढेन छित्वा || तत: पदं तत्परिमार्गितव्यं यस्मिन्गता न निवर्तन्ति भूय: |तमेव चाद्यं पुरुषं प्रपद्येयत: प्रवृत्ति: प्रसृता पुराणी ||
EN: The real form of this tree is not perceived in this world, neither its beginning nor end, nor its continued existence. But this deep-rooted aśhvatth tree must be cut down with a strong axe of detachment. Then one must search out the base of the tree, which is the Supreme Lord, from whom streamed forth the activity of the universe a long time ago. Upon taking refuge in him, one will not return to this world again.

SA: न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यतेनान्तो न चादिर्न च सम्प्रतिष्ठा |अश्वत्थमेनं सुविरूढमूलमसङ्गशस्त्रेण दृढेन छित्वा || तत: पदं तत्परिमार्गितव्यं यस्मिन्गता न निवर्तन्ति भूय: |तमेव चाद्यं पुरुषं प्रपद्येयत: प्रवृत्ति: प्रसृता पुराणी ||
EN: The real form of this tree is not perceived in this world, neither its beginning nor end, nor its continued existence. But this deep-rooted aśhvatth tree must be cut down with a strong axe of detachment. Then one must search out the base of the tree, which is the Supreme Lord, from whom streamed forth the activity of the universe a long time ago. Upon taking refuge in him, one will not return to this world again.

SA: निर्मानमोहा जितसङ्गदोषाअध्यात्मनित्या विनिवृत्तकामा: |द्वन्द्वैर्विमुक्ता: सुखदु:खसंज्ञैर्गच्छन्त्यमूढा: पदमव्ययं तत् ||
EN: Those who are free from vanity and delusion, who have overcome the evil of attachment, who dwell constantly in the self and God, who are freed from the desire to enjoy the senses, and are beyond the dualities of pleasure and pain, such liberated personalities attain my eternal abode.

SA: न तद्भासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावक: |यद्गत्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ||
EN: Neither the sun nor the moon, nor fire can illumine that supreme abode of mine. Having gone there, one does not return to this material world again.

SA: ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूत: सनातन: |मन:षष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति ||
EN: The embodied souls in this material world are my eternal fragmental parts. But bound by material nature, they are struggling with the six senses including the mind.

SA: शरीरं यदवाप्नोति यच्चाप्युत्क्रामतीश्वर: |गृहीत्वैतानि संयाति वायुर्गन्धानिवाशयात् ||
EN: As the air carries fragrance from place to place, so does the embodied soul carry the mind and senses with it, when it leaves an old body and enters a new one.

SA: श्रोत्रं चक्षु: स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च |अधिष्ठाय मनश्चायं विषयानुपसेवते ||
EN: Using the sense perceptions of the ears, eyes, skin, tongue, and nose, which are grouped around the mind, the embodied soul savors the objects of the senses.

SA: उत्क्रामन्तं स्थितं वापि भुञ्जानं वा गुणान्वितम् |विमूढा नानुपश्यन्ति पश्यन्ति ज्ञानचक्षुष: ||
EN: The ignorant do not perceive the soul as it resides in the body, and as it enjoys sense objects; nor do they perceive it when it departs. But those who possess the eyes of knowledge can behold it.

SA: यतन्तो योगिनश्चैनं पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम् |यतन्तोऽप्यकृतात्मानो नैनं पश्यन्त्यचेतस: ||
EN: Striving yogis too are able to realize the soul enshrined in the body. However, those whose minds are not purified cannot cognize it, even though they strive to do so.

SA: यदादित्यगतं तेजो जगद्भासयतेऽखिलम् |यच्चन्द्रमसि यच्चाग्नौ तत्तेजो विद्धि मामकम् ||
EN: Know that I am like the brilliance of the sun that illuminates the entire solar system. The radiance of the moon and the brightness of the fire also come from me.

SA: गामाविश्य च भूतानि धारयाम्यहमोजसा |पुष्णामि चौषधी: सर्वा: सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मक: ||
EN: Permeating the earth, I nourish all living beings with my energy. Becoming the moon, I nourish all plants with the juice of life.

SA: अहं वैश्वानरो भूत्वा प्राणिनां देहमाश्रित: |प्राणापानसमायुक्त: पचाम्यन्नं चतुर्विधम् ||
EN: It is I who take the form of the fire of digestion in the stomachs of all living beings, and combine with the incoming and outgoing breaths, to digest and assimilate the four kinds of foods.

SA: सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि सन्निविष्टोमत्त: स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनं च |वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्योवेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम् ||
EN: I am seated in the hearts of all living beings, and from me come memory, knowledge, as well as forgetfulness. I alone am to be known by all the Vedas, am the author of the Vedānt, and the knower of the meaning of the Vedas.

SA: द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ लोके क्षरश्चाक्षर एव च |क्षर: सर्वाणि भूतानि कूटस्थोऽक्षर उच्यते ||
EN: There are two kinds of beings in creation, the kṣhar (perishable) and the akṣhar (imperishable). The perishable are all beings in the material realm. The imperishable are the the liberated beings.

SA: उत्तम: पुरुषस्त्वन्य: परमात्मेत्युदाहृत: |यो लोकत्रयमाविश्य बिभर्त्यव्यय ईश्वर: ||
EN: Besides these, is the Supreme Divine Personality, who is the indestructible Supreme Soul. He enters the three worlds as the unchanging controller and supports all living beings.

SA: यस्मात्क्षरमतीतोऽहमक्षरादपि चोत्तम: |अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथित: पुरुषोत्तम: ||
EN: I am transcendental to the perishable world of matter, and even to the imperishable soul; hence I am celebrated, both in the Vedas and the Smṛitis, as the Supreme Divine Personality.

SA: यो मामेवमसम्मूढो जानाति पुरुषोत्तमम् |स सर्वविद्भजति मां सर्वभावेन भारत ||
EN: Those who know me without doubt as the Supreme Divine Personality truly have complete knowledge. O Arjun, they worship me with their whole being.

SA: इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रमिदमुक्तं मयानघ |एतद्बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमान्स्यात्कृतकृत्यश्च भारत ||
EN: I have shared this most secret principle of the Vedic scriptures with you, O sinless Arjun. By understanding this, a person becomes enlightened, and fulfills all that is to be accomplished.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |अभयं सत्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थिति: |दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् || अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्याग: शान्तिरपैशुनम् |दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् || तेज: क्षमा धृति: शौचमद्रोहोनातिमानिता |भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत ||
EN: The Supreme Divine Personality said: O scion of Bharat, these are the saintly virtues of those endowed with a divine nature—fearlessness, purity of mind, steadfastness in spiritual knowledge, charity, control of the senses, performance of sacrifice, study of the sacred books, austerity, and straightforwardness; non-violence, truthfulness, absence of anger, renunciation, peacefulness, restraint from fault-finding, compassion toward all living beings, absence of covetousness, gentleness, modesty, and lack of fickleness; vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, cleanliness, bearing enmity toward none, and absence of vanity.

EN: The Supreme Divine Personality said: O scion of Bharat, these are the saintly virtues of those endowed with a divine nature—fearlessness, purity of mind, steadfastness in spiritual knowledge, charity, control of the senses, performance of sacrifice, study of the sacred books, austerity, and straightforwardness; non-violence, truthfulness, absence of anger, renunciation, peacefulness, restraint from fault-finding, compassion toward all living beings, absence of covetousness, gentleness, modesty, and lack of fickleness; vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, cleanliness, bearing enmity toward none, and absence of vanity.

SA: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोध: पारुष्यमेव च |अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदमासुरीम् ||
EN: O Parth, the qualities of those who possess a demoniac nature are hypocrisy, arrogance, conceit, anger, harshness, and ignorance.

SA: दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता |मा शुच: सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव ||
EN: The divine qualities lead to liberation, while the demoniac qualities are the cause for a continuing destiny of bondage. Grieve not, O Arjun, as you were born with saintly virtues.

SA: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च |दैवो विस्तरश: प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु ||
EN: There are two kinds of beings in this world—those endowed with a divine nature and those possessing a demoniac nature. I have described the divine qualities in detail, O Arjun. Now hear from me about the demoniac nature.

SA: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुरा: |न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते ||
EN: Those possessing a demoniac nature do not comprehend what actions are proper and what are improper. Hence, they possess neither purity, nor good conduct, nor even truthfulness.

SA: असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् |अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम् ||
EN: They say, “The world is without absolute truth, without any basis (for moral order), and without a God (who has created or is controlling it). It is created from the combination of the two sexes, and has no purpose other than sexual gratification.”

SA: एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धय: |प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माण: क्षयाय जगतोऽहिता: ||
EN: Holding fast to such views, these misdirected souls, with small intellect and cruel actions, arise as enemies of the world threatening its destruction.

SA: काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विता: |मोहाद्गृहीत्वासद्ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽशुचिव्रता: ||
EN: Harboring insatiable lust, full of hypocrisy, pride and arrogance, the demoniac cling to their false tenets. Thus illusioned, they are attracted to the impermanent and work with impure resolve.

SA: चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिता: |कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिता: ||
EN: They are obsessed with endless anxieties that end only with death. Still, they maintain with complete assurance that gratification of desires and accumulation of wealth is the highest purpose of life.

SA: आशापाशशतैर्बद्धा: कामक्रोधपरायणा: |ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्जयान् ||
EN: Held in bondage by hundreds of desires, and driven by lust and anger, they strive to accumulate wealth by unjust means, all for the gratification of their senses.

SA: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् |इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम् || असौ मया हत: शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि |ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी || आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया |यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिता: ||
EN: The demoniac persons think, “I have gained so much wealth today, and I shall now fulfill this desire of mine. This is mine, and tomorrow I shall have even more. That enemy has been destroyed by me, and I shall destroy the others too! I am like God himself, I am the enjoyer, I am powerful, and I am happy. I am wealthy and I have highly placed relatives. Who else is equal to me? I shall perform sacrifices (to the celestial gods); I shall give alms; I shall rejoice.” In this way, they are deluded by ignorance.

SA: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् |इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम् || असौ मया हत: शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि |ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी || आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया |यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिता: ||
EN: The demoniac persons think, “I have gained so much wealth today, and I shall now fulfill this desire of mine. This is mine, and tomorrow I shall have even more. That enemy has been destroyed by me, and I shall destroy the others too! I am like God himself, I am the enjoyer, I am powerful, and I am happy. I am wealthy and I have highly placed relatives. Who else is equal to me? I shall perform sacrifices (to the celestial gods); I shall give alms; I shall rejoice.” In this way, they are deluded by ignorance.

SA: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् |इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम् || असौ मया हत: शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि |ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी || आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया |यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिता: ||
EN: The demoniac persons think, “I have gained so much wealth today, and I shall now fulfill this desire of mine. This is mine, and tomorrow I shall have even more. That enemy has been destroyed by me, and I shall destroy the others too! I am like God himself, I am the enjoyer, I am powerful, and I am happy. I am wealthy and I have highly placed relatives. Who else is equal to me? I shall perform sacrifices (to the celestial gods); I shall give alms; I shall rejoice.” In this way, they are deluded by ignorance.

SA: अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृता: |प्रसक्ता: कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽशुचौ ||
EN: Possessed and led astray by such imaginings, enveloped in a mesh of delusion, and addicted to the gratification of sensuous pleasures, they descend to the murkiest hell.

SA: आत्मसम्भाविता: स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विता: |यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम् ||
EN: Such self-conceited and stubborn people, full of pride and arrogant in their wealth, perform ostentatious sacrifices in name only, with no regard to the rules of the scriptures.

SA: अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिता: |मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयका: ||
EN: Blinded by egotism, strength, arrogance, desire, and anger, the demonic abuse my presence within their own body and in the bodies of others.

SA: तानहं द्विषत: क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् |क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु || आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि |मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम् ||
EN: These cruel and hateful persons, the vile and vicious of humankind, I constantly hurl into the wombs of those with similar demoniac natures in the cycle of rebirth in the material world. These ignorant souls take birth again and again in demoniac wombs. Failing to reach me, O Arjun, they gradually sink to the most abominable type of existence.

SA: तानहं द्विषत: क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् |क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु || आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि |मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम् ||
EN: These cruel and hateful persons, the vile and vicious of humankind, I constantly hurl into the wombs of those with similar demoniac natures in the cycle of rebirth in the material world. These ignorant souls take birth again and again in demoniac wombs. Failing to reach me, O Arjun, they gradually sink to the most abominable type of existence.

SA: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मन: |काम: क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत् ||
EN: There are three gates leading to the hell of self-destruction for the soul—lust, anger, and greed. Therefore, all should abandon these three.

SA: एतैर्विमुक्त: कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नर: |आचरत्यात्मन: श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ||
EN: Those who are freed from the three gates to darkness endeavor for the welfare of their soul, and thereby attain the supreme goal.

SA: य: शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारत: |न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम् ||
EN: Those who act under the impulse of desire, discarding the injunctions of the scriptures, attain neither perfection, nor happiness, nor the supreme goal in life.

SA: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ |ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि ||
EN: Therefore, let the scriptures be your authority in determining what should be done and what should not be done. Understand the scriptural injunctions and teachings, and then perform your actions in this world accordingly.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विता: |तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्वमाहो रजस्तम: ||
EN: Arjun said: O Krishna, where do they stand who disregard the injunctions of the scriptures, but still worship with faith? Is their faith in the mode of goodness, passion, or ignorance?

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा |सात्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु ||
EN: The Supreme Divine Personality said: Every human being is born with innate faith, which can be of three kinds—sāttvic, rājasic, or tāmasic. Now hear about this from me.

SA: सत्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत |श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्ध: स एव स: ||
EN: The faith of all humans conforms to the nature of their mind. All people possess faith, and whatever the nature of their faith, that is verily what they are.

SA: यजन्ते सात्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसा: |प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जना: ||
EN: Those in the mode of goodness worship the celestial gods; those in the mode of passion worship the yakṣhas and rākṣhasas; those in the mode of ignorance worship ghosts and spirits.

SA: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जना: |दम्भाहङ्कारसंयुक्ता: कामरागबलान्विता: || कर्षयन्त: शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतस: |मां चैवान्त:शरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान् ||
EN: Some people perform stern austerities that are not enjoined by the scriptures, but rather motivated by hypocrisy and egotism. Impelled by desire and attachment, they torment not only the elements of their body, but also I who dwell within them as the Supreme Soul. Know these senseless people to be of demoniacal resolves.

SA: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जना: |दम्भाहङ्कारसंयुक्ता: कामरागबलान्विता: || कर्षयन्त: शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतस: |मां चैवान्त:शरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान् ||
EN: Some people perform stern austerities that are not enjoined by the scriptures, but rather motivated by hypocrisy and egotism. Impelled by desire and attachment, they torment not only the elements of their body, but also I who dwell within them as the Supreme Soul. Know these senseless people to be of demoniacal resolves.

SA: आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रिय: |यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं शृणु ||
EN: The food persons prefer is according to their dispositions. The same is true for the sacrifice, austerity, and charity they incline toward. Now hear of the distinctions from me.

SA: आयु:सत्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धना: |रस्या: स्निग्धा: स्थिरा हृद्या आहारा: सात्विकप्रिया: ||
EN: Persons in the mode of goodness prefer foods that promote the life span, and increase virtue, strength, health, happiness, and satisfaction. Such foods are juicy, succulent, nourishing, and naturally tasteful.

SA: कट्वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिन: |आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दु:खशोकामयप्रदा: ||
EN: Foods that are too bitter, too sour, salty, very hot, pungent, dry, and chiliful, are dear to persons in the mode of passion. Such foods produce pain, grief, and disease.

SA: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् |उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम् ||
EN: Foods that are overcooked, stale, putrid, polluted, and impure are dear to persons in the mode of ignorance.

SA: अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते |यष्टव्यमेवेति मन: समाधाय स सात्विक: ||
EN: Sacrifice that is performed according to the scriptural injunctions without expectation of rewards, with the firm conviction of the mind that it is a matter of duty is of the nature of goodness.

SA: अभिसन्धाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत् |इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम् ||
EN: O best of the Bharatas, know that sacrifice, which is performed for material benefit, or with hypocritical aim, to be in the mode of passion.

SA: विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनमदक्षिणम् |श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते ||
EN: Sacrifice devoid of faith and contrary to the injunctions of the scriptures, in which no food is offered, no mantras chanted, and no donation made, is to be considered in the mode of ignorance.

SA: देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् |ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते ||
EN: Worship of the Supreme Lord, the Brahmins, the spiritual master, the wise, and the elders—when this is done with the observance of cleanliness, simplicity, celibacy, and non-violence—is declared as the austerity of the body.

SA: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत् |स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते ||
EN: Words that do not cause distress, are truthful, inoffensive, and beneficial, as well as the regular recitation of the Vedic scriptures—these are declared as the austerity of speech.

SA: मन: प्रसाद: सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रह: |भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते ||
EN: Serenity of thought, gentleness, silence, self-control, and purity of purpose—all these are declared as the austerity of the mind.

SA: श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत्त्रिविधं नरै: |अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्युक्तै: सात्विकं परिचक्षते ||
EN: When devout persons with ardent faith practice these three-fold austerities without yearning for material rewards, they are designated as austerities in the mode of goodness.

SA: सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत् |क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम् ||
EN: Austerity that is performed with ostentation for the sake of gaining honor, respect, and adoration is in the mode of passion. Its benefits are unstable and transitory.

SA: मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तप: |परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||
EN: Austerity that is performed by those with confused notions, and which involves torturing the self or harming others, is described to be in the mode of ignorance.

SA: दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे |देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्विकं स्मृतम् ||
EN: Charity given to a worthy person simply because it is right to give, without consideration of anything in return, at the proper time and in the proper place, is stated to be in the mode of goodness.

SA: यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुन: |दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम् ||
EN: But charity given with reluctance, with the hope of a return or in expectation of a reward, is said to be in the mode of passion.

SA: अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते |असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||
EN: And that charity, which is given at the wrong place and wrong time to unworthy persons, without showing respect, or with contempt, is held to be of the nature of nescience.

SA: ॐ तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविध: स्मृत: |ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिता: पुरा ||
EN: The words “Om Tat Sat” have been declared as symbolic representations of the Supreme Absolute Truth, from the beginning of creation. From them came the priests, scriptures, and sacrifice.

SA: तस्माद् ॐ इत्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतप:क्रिया: |प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ता: सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ||
EN: Therefore, when performing acts of sacrifice, offering charity, or undertaking penance, expounders of the Vedas always begin by uttering “Om” according to the prescriptions of Vedic injunctions.

SA: तदित्यनभिसन्धाय फलं यज्ञतप:क्रिया: |दानक्रियाश्च विविधा: क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्क्षिभि: ||
EN: Persons who do not desire fruitive rewards, but seek to be free from material entanglements, utter the word “Tat” along with acts of austerity, sacrifice, and charity.

SA: सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते |प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्द: पार्थ युज्यते || यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थिति: सदिति चोच्यते |कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते ||
EN: The word “Sat” means eternal existence and goodness. O Arjun, it is also used to describe an auspicious action. Being established in the performance of sacrifice, penance, and charity, is also described by the word “Sat.” And so any act for such purposes is named “Sat.”

SA: सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते |प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्द: पार्थ युज्यते || यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थिति: सदिति चोच्यते |कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते ||
EN: The word “Sat” means eternal existence and goodness. O Arjun, it is also used to describe an auspicious action. Being established in the performance of sacrifice, penance, and charity, is also described by the word “Sat.” And so any act for such purposes is named “Sat.”

SA: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत् |असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह ||
EN: O son of Pritha, whatever acts of sacrifice or penance are done without faith, are termed as “Asat.” They are useless both in this world and the next.

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |सन्न्यासस्य महाबाहो तत्वमिच्छामि वेदितुम् |त्यागस्य च हृषीकेश पृथक्केशिनिषूदन ||
EN: Arjun said: O mighty-armed Krishna, I wish to understand the nature of sanyās (renunciation of actions) and tyāg (renunciation of the desire for the fruits of actions). O Hrishikesh, I also wish to know the distinction between the two, O Keshinisudan.

SA: श्रीभगवानुवाच |काम्यानां कर्मणां न्यासं सन्न्यासं कवयो विदु: |सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं प्राहुस्त्यागं विचक्षणा: ||
EN: The Supreme Divine Personality said: Giving up of actions motivated by desire is what the wise understand as sanyās. Relinquishing the fruits of all actions is what the learned declare to be tyāg.

SA: त्याज्यं दोषवदित्येके कर्म प्राहुर्मनीषिण: |यज्ञदानतप:कर्म न त्याज्यमिति चापरे ||
EN: Some learned people declare that all kinds of actions should be given up as evil, while others maintain that acts of sacrifice, charity, and penance should never be abandoned.

SA: निश्चयं शृणु मे तत्र त्यागे भरतसत्तम |त्यागो हि पुरुषव्याघ्र त्रिविध: सम्प्रकीर्तित: ||
EN: Now hear my conclusion on the subject of renunciation, O tiger amongst men, for renunciation has been declared to be of three kinds.

SA: यज्ञदानतप:कर्म न त्याज्यं कार्यमेव तत् |यज्ञो दानं तपश्चैव पावनानि मनीषिणाम् ||
EN: Actions based upon sacrifice, charity, and penance should never be abandoned; they must certainly be performed. Indeed, acts of sacrifice, charity, and penance are purifying even for those who are wise.

SA: एतान्यपि तु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलानि च |कर्तव्यानीति मे पार्थ निश्चितं मतमुत्तमम् ||
EN: These activities must be performed without attachment and expectation for rewards. This is my definite and supreme verdict, O Arjun.

SA: नियतस्य तु सन्न्यास: कर्मणो नोपपद्यते |मोहात्तस्य परित्यागस्तामस: परिकीर्तित: ||
EN: Prescribed duties should never be renounced. Such deluded renunciation is said to be in the mode of ignorance.

SA: दु:खमित्येव यत्कर्म कायक्लेशभयात्यजेत् |स कृत्वा राजसं त्यागं नैव त्यागफलं लभेत् ||
EN: To give up prescribed duties because they are troublesome or cause bodily discomfort is renunciation in the mode of passion. Such renunciation is never beneficial or elevating.

SA: कार्यमित्येव यत्कर्म नियतं क्रियतेऽर्जुन |सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलं चैव स त्याग: सात्विको मत: ||
EN: When actions are taken in response to duty, Arjun, and one relinquishes attachment to any reward, it is considered renunciation in the nature of goodness.

SA: न द्वेष्ट्यकुशलं कर्म कुशले नानुषज्जते |त्यागी सत्वसमाविष्टो मेधावी छिन्नसंशय: ||
EN: Those who neither avoid disagreeable work nor seek work because it is agreeable are persons of true renunciation. They are endowed with the quality of the mode of goodness and have no doubts (about the nature of work).

SA: न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषत: |यस्तु कर्मफलत्यागी स त्यागीत्यभिधीयते ||
EN: For the embodied being, it is impossible to give up activities entirely. But those who relinquish the fruits of their actions are said to be truly renounced.

SA: अनिष्टमिष्टं मिश्रं च त्रिविधं कर्मण: फलम् |भवत्यत्यागिनां प्रेत्य न तु सन्न्यासिनां क्वचित् ||
EN: The three-fold fruits of actions—pleasant, unpleasant, and mixed—accrue even after death to those who are attached to personal reward. But, for those who renounce the fruits of their actions, there are no such results in the here or hereafter.

SA: पञ्चैतानि महाबाहो कारणानि निबोध मे |साङ् ख्ये कृतान्ते प्रोक्तानि सिद्धये सर्वकर्मणाम् ||
EN: O Arjun, now learn from me about the five factors that have been mentioned for the accomplishment of all actions in the doctrine of Sānkhya, which explains how to stop the reactions of karmas.

SA: अधिष्ठानं तथा कर्ता करणं च पृथग्विधम् |विविधाश्च पृथक्चेष्टा दैवं चैवात्र पञ्चमम् ||
EN: The body, the doer, the various senses, the many kinds of efforts, and Divine Providence—these are the five factors of action.

SA: शरीरवाङ्मनोभिर्यत्कर्म प्रारभते नर: |न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतव: || तत्रैवं सति कर्तारमात्मानं केवलं तु य: |पश्यत्यकृतबुद्धित्वान्न स पश्यति दुर्मति: ||
EN: These five are the contributory factors for whatever action is performed, whether proper or improper, with body, speech, or mind. Those who do not understand this regard the soul as the only doer. With their impure intellects they cannot see things as they are.

SA: शरीरवाङ्मनोभिर्यत्कर्म प्रारभते नर: |न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतव: || तत्रैवं सति कर्तारमात्मानं केवलं तु य: |पश्यत्यकृतबुद्धित्वान्न स पश्यति दुर्मति: ||
EN: These five are the contributory factors for whatever action is performed, whether proper or improper, with body, speech, or mind. Those who do not understand this regard the soul as the only doer. With their impure intellects they cannot see things as they are.

SA: यस्य नाहङ् कृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते |हत्वाऽपि स इमाँल्लोकान्न हन्ति न निबध्यते ||
EN: Those who are free from the ego of being the doer, and whose intellect is unattached, though they may slay living beings, they neither kill nor are they bound by actions.

SA: ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं परिज्ञाता त्रिविधा कर्मचोदना |करणं कर्म कर्तेति त्रिविध: कर्मसंग्रह: ||
EN: Knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the knower—these are the three factors that induce action. The instrument of action, the act itself, and the doer—these are the three constituents of action.

SA: ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ता च त्रिधैव गुणभेदत: |प्रोच्यते गुणसङ् ख्याने यथावच्छृणु तान्यपि ||
EN: Knowledge, action, and the doer are declared to be of three kinds in the Sānkhya philosophy, distinguished according to the three modes of material nature. Listen, and I will explain their distinctions to you.

SA: सर्वभूतेषु येनैकं भावमव्ययमीक्षते |अविभक्तं विभक्तेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि सात्विकम् ||
EN: Understand that knowledge to be in the mode of goodness by which a person sees one undivided imperishable reality within all diverse living beings.

SA: पृथक्त्वेन तु यज्ज्ञानं नानाभावान्पृथग्विधान् |वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम् ||
EN: That knowledge is to be considered in the mode of passion by which one sees the manifold living entities in diverse bodies as individual and unconnected.

SA: यत्तु कृत्स्नवदेकस्मिन्कार्ये सक्तमहैतुकम् |अतत्वार्थवदल्पं च तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||
EN: That knowledge is said to be in the mode of ignorance where one is engrossed in a fragmental concept as if it encompasses the whole, and which is neither grounded in reason nor based on the truth.

SA: नियतं सङ्गरहितमरागद्वेषत: कृतम् |अफलप्रेप्सुना कर्म यतत्सात्विकमुच्यते ||
EN: Action that is in accordance with the scriptures, which is free from attachment and aversion, and which is done without desire for rewards, is in the mode of goodness.

SA: यत्तुकामेप्सुना कर्म साहङ्कारेण वा पुन: |क्रियते बहुलायासं तद्राजसमुदाहृतम् ||
EN: Action that is prompted by selfish desire, enacted with pride, and full of stress, is in the nature of passion.

SA: अनुबन्धं क्षयं हिंसामनपेक्ष्य च पौरुषम् |मोहादारभ्यते कर्म यतत्तामसमुच्यते ||
EN: That action is declared to be in the mode of ignorance, which is begun out of delusion, without thought to one’s own ability, and disregarding consequences, loss, and injury to others.

SA: मुक्तसङ्गोऽनहंवादी धृत्युत्साहसमन्वित: |सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योर्निर्विकार: कर्ता सात्विक उच्यते ||
EN: The performer is said to be in the mode of goodness, when he or she is free from egotism and attachment, endowed with enthusiasm and determination, and equipoised in success and failure.

SA: रागी कर्मफलप्रेप्सुर्लुब्धो हिंसात्मकोऽशुचि: |हर्षशोकान्वित: कर्ता राजस: परिकीर्तित: ||
EN: The performer is considered in the mode of passion when he or she craves the fruits of the work, is covetous, violent-natured, impure, and moved by joy and sorrow.

SA: अयुक्त: प्राकृत: स्तब्ध: शठो नैष्कृतिकोऽलस: |विषादी दीर्घसूत्री च कर्ता तामस उच्यते ||
EN: A performer in the mode of ignorance is one who is undisciplined, vulgar, stubborn, deceitful, slothful, despondent, and procrastinating.

SA: बुद्धेर्भेदं धृतेश्चैव गुणतस्त्रिविधं शृणु |प्रोच्यमानमशेषेण पृथक्त्वेन धनञ्जय ||
EN: Hear now, O Arjun, of the distinctions of intellect and determination, according to the three modes of material nature, as I describe them in detail.

SA: प्रवृत्तिंच निवृत्तिं च कार्याकार्ये भयाभये |बन्धं मोक्षं च या वेत्तिबुद्धि: सा पार्थ सात्विकी ||
EN: The intellect is said to be in the nature of goodness, O Parth, when it understands what is proper action and what is improper action, what is duty and what is non-duty, what is to be feared and what is not to be feared, what is binding and what is liberating.

SA: यया धर्ममधर्मं च कार्यं चाकार्यमेव च |अयथावत्प्रजानाति बुद्धि: सा पार्थ राजसी ||
EN: The intellect is considered in the mode of passion when it is confused between righteousness and unrighteousness, and cannot distinguish between right and wrong conduct.

SA: अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसावृता |सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धि: सा पार्थ तामसी ||
EN: That intellect which is shrouded in darkness, imagining irreligion to be religion, and perceiving untruth to be the truth, is of the nature of ignorance.

SA: धृत्या यया धारयते मन:प्राणेन्द्रियक्रिया: |योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृति: सा पार्थ सात्विकी ||
EN: The steadfast will that is developed through Yog, and which sustains the activities of the mind, the life-airs, and the senses, is said to be determination in the mode of goodness.

SA: यया तु धर्मकामार्थान्धृत्या धारयतेऽर्जुन |प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ् क्षी धृति: सा पार्थ राजसी ||
EN: The steadfast will by which one holds to duty, pleasures, and wealth, out of attachment and desire for rewards, is determination in the mode of passion.

SA: यया स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च |न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृति: सा पार्थ तामसी ||
EN: That unintelligent resolve is said to be determination in the mode of ignorance, in which one does not give up dreaming, fearing, grieving, despair, and conceit.

SA: सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं शृणु मे भरतर्षभ |अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दु:खान्तं च निगच्छति ||
EN: And now hear from me, O Arjun, of the three kinds of happiness in which the embodied soul rejoices, and can even reach the end of all suffering.

SA: यत्तदग्रे विषमिव परिणामेऽमृतोपमम् |तत्सुखं सात्विकं प्रोक्तमात्मबुद्धिप्रसादजम् ||
EN: That which seems like poison at first, but tastes like nectar in the end, is said to be happiness in the mode of goodness. It is generated by the pure intellect that is situated in self-knowledge.

SA: विषयेन्द्रियसंयोगाद्यत्तदग्रेऽमृतोपमम् |परिणामे विषमिव तत्सुखं राजसं स्मृतम् ||
EN: Happiness is said to be in the mode of passion when it is derived from the contact of the senses with their objects. Such happiness is like nectar at first but poison at the end.

SA: यदग्रे चानुबन्धे च सुखं मोहनमात्मन: |निद्रालस्यप्रमादोत्थं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||
EN: That happiness which covers the nature of the self from beginning to end, and which is derived from sleep, indolence, and negligence, is said to be in the mode of ignorance.

SA: न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुन: |सत्वं प्रकृतिजैर्मुक्तं यदेभि: स्यात्त्रिभिर्गुणै: ||
EN: No living being on earth or the higher celestial abodes in this material realm is free from the influence of these three modes of nature.

SA: ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परन्तप |कर्माणि प्रविभक्तानि स्वभावप्रभवैर्गुणै: ||
EN: The duties of the Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras—are distributed according to their qualities, in accordance with their guṇas (and not by birth).

SA: शमो दमस्तप: शौचं क्षान्तिरार्जवमेव च |ज्ञानं विज्ञानमास्तिक्यं ब्रह्मकर्म स्वभावजम् ||
EN: Tranquility, restraint, austerity, purity, patience, integrity, knowledge, wisdom, and belief in a hereafter—these are the intrinsic qualities of work for Brahmins.

SA: शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम् |दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षात्रं कर्म स्वभावजम् ||
EN: Valor, strength, fortitude, skill in weaponry, resolve never to retreat from battle, large-heartedness in charity, and leadership abilities, these are the natural qualities of work for Kshatriyas.

SA: कृषिगौरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं वैश्यकर्म स्वभावजम् |परिचर्यात्मकं कर्म शूद्रस्यापि स्वभावजम् ||
EN: Agriculture, dairy farming, and commerce are the natural works for those with the qualities of Vaishyas. Serving through work is the natural duty for those with the qualities of Shudras.

SA: स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरत: संसिद्धिं लभते नर: |स्वकर्मनिरत: सिद्धिं यथा विन्दति तच्छृणु ||
EN: By fulfilling their duties, born of their innate qualities, human beings can attain perfection. Now hear from me how one can become perfect by discharging one’s prescribed duties.

SA: यत: प्रवृत्तिर्भूतानां येन सर्वमिदं ततम् |स्वकर्मणा तमभ्यर्च्य सिद्धिं विन्दति मानव: ||
EN: By performing one’s natural occupation, one worships the Creator from whom all living entities have come into being, and by whom the whole universe is pervaded. By such performance of work, a person easily attains perfection.

SA: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुण: परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् |स्वभावनियतं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम् ||
EN: It is better to do one’s own dharma, even though imperfectly, than to do another’s dharma, even though perfectly. By doing one’s innate duties, a person does not incur sin.

SA: सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत् |सर्वारम्भा हि दोषेण धूमेनाग्निरिवावृता: ||
EN: One should not abandon duties born of one’s nature, even if one sees defects in them, O son of Kunti. Indeed, all endeavors are veiled by some evil, as fire is by smoke.

SA: असक्तबुद्धि: सर्वत्र जितात्मा विगतस्पृह: |नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं परमां सन्न्यासेनाधिगच्छति ||
EN: Those whose intellect is unattached everywhere, who have mastered the mind, and are free from desires by the practice of renunciation, attain the highest perfection of freedom from action.

SA: सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे |समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा ||
EN: Hear from me briefly, O Arjun, and I shall explain how one, who has attained perfection (of cessation of actions), can also attain Brahman by being firmly fixed in transcendental knowledge.

SA: बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्यात्मानं नियम्य च |शब्दादीन्विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च || विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानस: |ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रित: || अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम् |विमुच्य निर्मम: शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ||
EN: One becomes fit to attain Brahman when he or she possesses a purified intellect and firmly restrains the senses, abandoning sound and other objects of the senses, casting aside attraction and aversion. Such a person relishes solitude, eats lightly, controls body, mind, and speech, is ever engaged in meditation, and practices dispassion. Free from egotism, violence, arrogance, desire, possessiveness of property, and selfishness, such a person, situated in tranquility, is fit for union with Brahman (i.e., realization of the Absolute Truth as Brahman).

SA: बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्यात्मानं नियम्य च |शब्दादीन्विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च || विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानस: |ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रित: || अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम् |विमुच्य निर्मम: शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ||
EN: One becomes fit to attain Brahman when he or she possesses a purified intellect and firmly restrains the senses, abandoning sound and other objects of the senses, casting aside attraction and aversion. Such a person relishes solitude, eats lightly, controls body, mind, and speech, is ever engaged in meditation, and practices dispassion. Free from egotism, violence, arrogance, desire, possessiveness of property, and selfishness, such a person, situated in tranquility, is fit for union with Brahman (i.e., realization of the Absolute Truth as Brahman).

SA: बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्यात्मानं नियम्य च |शब्दादीन्विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च || विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानस: |ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रित: || अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम् |विमुच्य निर्मम: शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ||
EN: One becomes fit to attain Brahman when he or she possesses a purified intellect and firmly restrains the senses, abandoning sound and other objects of the senses, casting aside attraction and aversion. Such a person relishes solitude, eats lightly, controls body, mind, and speech, is ever engaged in meditation, and practices dispassion. Free from egotism, violence, arrogance, desire, possessiveness of property, and selfishness, such a person, situated in tranquility, is fit for union with Brahman (i.e., realization of the Absolute Truth as Brahman).

SA: ब्रह्मभूत: प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ् क्षति |सम: सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम् ||
EN: One situated in the transcendental Brahman realization becomes mentally serene, neither grieving nor desiring. Being equitably disposed toward all living beings, such a yogi attains supreme devotion unto me.

SA: भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्वत: |ततो मां तत्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम् ||
EN: Only by loving devotion to me does one come to know who I am in truth. Then, having come to know me, my devotee enters into full consciousness of me.

SA: सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रय: |मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम् ||
EN: My devotees, though performing all kinds of actions, take full refuge in me. By my grace, they attain the eternal and imperishable abode.

SA: चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि सन्न्यस्य मत्पर: |बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्त: सततं भव ||
EN: Dedicate your every activity to me, making me your supreme goal. Taking shelter of the Yog of the intellect, keep your consciousness absorbed in me always.

SA: मच्चित्त: सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि |अथ चेत्वमहङ्कारान्न श्रोष्यसि विनङ्क्ष्यसि ||
EN: If you remember me always, by my grace you will overcome all obstacles and difficulties. But if, due to pride, you do not listen to my advice, you will perish.

SA: यदहङ्कारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे |मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति ||
EN: If, motivated by pride, you think, “I shall not fight,” your decision will be in vain. Your own material (Kshatriya) nature will compel you to fight.

SA: स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्ध: स्वेन कर्मणा |कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात्करिष्यस्यवशोऽपि तत् ||
EN: O Arjun, that action which out of delusion you do not wish to do, you will be driven to do it by your own inclination, born of your own material nature.

SA: ईश्वर: सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति |भ्रामयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया ||
EN: The Supreme Lord dwells in the hearts of all living beings, O Arjun. According to their karmas, he directs the wanderings of the souls, who are seated on a machine made of the material energy.

SA: तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत |तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम् ||
EN: Surrender exclusively unto him with your whole being, O Bharat. By his grace, you will attain perfect peace and the eternal abode.

SA: इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया |विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु ||
EN: Thus, I have explained to you this knowledge that is more secret than all secrets. Ponder over it deeply, and then do as you wish.

SA: सर्वगुह्यतमं भूय: शृणु मे परमं वच: |इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम् ||
EN: Hear again my supreme instruction, the most confidential of all knowledge. I am revealing this for your benefit because you are very dear to me.

SA: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु |मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे ||
EN: Always think of me, be devoted to me, worship me, and offer obeisance to me. Doing so, you will certainly come to me. This is my pledge to you, for you are very dear to me.

SA: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज |अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुच: ||
EN: Abandon all varieties of dharmas and simply surrender unto me alone. I shall liberate you from all sinful reactions; do not fear.

SA: इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन |न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति ||
EN: This instruction should never be explained to those who are not austere or to those who are not devoted. It should also not be spoken to those who are averse to listening (to spiritual topics), and especially not to those who are envious of me.

SA: य इदं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति |भक्तिं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशय: ||
EN: Those, who teach this most confidential knowledge amongst my devotees, perform the greatest act of love. They will come to me without doubt.

SA: न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मे प्रियकृत्तम: |भविता न च मे तस्मादन्य: प्रियतरो भुवि ||
EN: No human being does more loving service to me than they; nor shall there ever be anyone on this earth more dear to me.

SA: अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयो: |ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्ट: स्यामिति मे मति: ||
EN: And I proclaim that those who study this sacred dialogue of ours will worship me (with their intellect) through the sacrifice of knowledge; such is my view.

SA: श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च शृणुयादपि यो नर: |सोऽपि मुक्त: शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम् ||
EN: Even those who only listen to this knowledge with faith and without envy will be liberated from sins and attain the auspicious abodes where the pious dwell.

SA: कच्चिदेतच्छ्रुतं पार्थ त्वयैकाग्रेण चेतसा |कच्चिदज्ञानसम्मोह: प्रनष्टस्ते धनञ्जय ||
EN: O Arjun, have you heard me with a concentrated mind? Have your ignorance and delusion been destroyed?

SA: अर्जुन उवाच |नष्टो मोह: स्मृतिर्लब्धा त्वत्प्रसादान्मयाच्युत |स्थितोऽस्मि गतसन्देह: करिष्ये वचनं तव ||
EN: Arjun Said: O infallible one, by your grace my illusion has been dispelled, and I am situated in knowledge. I am now free from doubts, and I shall act according to your instructions.

SA: सञ्जय उवाच |इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मन: |संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम् ||
EN: Sanjay said: Thus, have I heard this wonderful conversation between Shree Krishna, the son of Vasudev, and Arjun, the noble-hearted son of Pritha. So thrilling is the message that my hair is standing on end.

SA: व्यासप्रसादाच्छ्रुतवानेतद्गुह्यमहं परम् |योगं योगेश्वरात्कृष्णात्साक्षात्कथयत: स्वयम् ||
EN: By the grace of Veda Vyas, I have heard this supreme and most secret Yog from the Lord of Yog, Shree Krishna himself.

SA: राजन्संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य संवादमिममद्भुतम् |केशवार्जुनयो: पुण्यं हृष्यामि च मुहुर्मुहु: ||
EN: As I repeatedly recall this astonishing and wonderful dialogue between the Supreme Lord Shree Krishna and Arjun, O King, I rejoice again and again.

SA: तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरे: |विस्मयो मे महानराजन्हृष्यामि च पुन: पुन: ||
EN: And remembering that most astonishing and wonderful cosmic form of Lord Krishna, great is my astonishment, and I am thrilled with joy over and over again.

SA: यत्र योगेश्वर: कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धर: |तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम ||
EN: Wherever there is Shree Krishna, the Lord of all Yog, and wherever there is Arjun, the supreme archer, there will also certainly be unending opulence, victory, prosperity, and righteousness. Of this, I am certain.
